Title: Remote AS400/Synon Application Developer
Job_Description:
As the AS400/Synon Developer Application Developer, you will be responsible for the hands-on development and maintenance of AS400 software applications critical to the operations of CVS Health. The AS400/Synon Developer Application Developer is essential to ensuring the success of the RxClaim Adjudication team in their support of both internal and external clients. You will be part of the project team comprised of both employee and contract staff, and will also partner with project leaders, business stakeholders and managers in accomplishing the projects.

As the Senior AS400/Synon Developer Application Developer, you will be providing:
Solutions to technical and functional requirements
Estimations with little or no variance
System design
Problem resolutions and guidance to other team members and support operations


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 60,000
Maximum: 128,700

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.






Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent. Will consider High School Diploma/GED plus one year of work experience for each year of college not attained in addition to required years of experience.

Title: Remote AS400/Synon Application Developer
Job_Description:
Join CVS Specialty as a Senior Analyst of Application Development. In this position you will serve as a hands on member for one or more Specialty applications.

Our Specialty Development team is seeking a Senior Analyst to participate in the design, development, maintenance and support of Adverse Drug Event (ADE) applications within CVS Health Specialty. You will be responsible and accountable for the quality and cohesion of solutions within the application area and their conformity to approved CVS/Caremark IT standards. Within the application development area, may oversee life cycle process (e.g., design, analysis, review) and testing results to ensure adherence to quality requirements and ensure the product works.

Responsibilities:
1. Partner with teams and serve as subject matter expert to provide benchmarked solutions to multiple, complex technical projects/initiatives using multiple interlocking technologies.
2. Keep abreast of technological trends in the industry and make appropriate technology recommendations to the organization. Keep abreast of business strategies and plans in the company and make appropriate technology recommendations to the organization.
3. Establish and drive execution of technical direction, standards, guidelines and methodology for use of specified technologies.
4. Plan and manage integration of new technology and monitor transition from current to new.
5. Solve highly technical and complex problems.


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 60,000
Maximum: 128,700

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.






Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience

Title: Remote AS400/Synon Application Developer
Job_Description:
CVS Health Digital is looking for hands-on, passionate people who want to join a high energy and growing team to make a difference in customers’ lives and who want to be on the
forefront of digital innovation that aims to reinvent what a pharmacy and a health care company can be in the digital world.
This role includes closely working with a team of engineers to drive delivery excellence, partner with business and other
IT leaders to build digital assets, provide expert level support to resolve complex issues and provide RCA,
identify gaps in systems in current digital eco system and provide solutions to enhance overall performance.
All of this is critical to driving Digital growth and improving customer experience.
This individual will collaborate with digital leaders, business partners, and IT colleagues to deliver business growth and great customer experiences
that differentiate CVS in the market, while ensuring efficient, effective and SAFe development.


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 75,000
Maximum: 167,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


5+ years of overall Software/Digital development experience

5+ years of microservices, cloud native applications development and web development experience using tools such as React JS, CSS, Java/J2EE, Spring Framework, NodeJS, Messaging Frameworks (i.e, Kafka/Rabbit MQ), NoSQL/RDBMS databases (i.e, Mongo DB, PostgresSQL, Redis), and other tech stacks (Open source and proprietary)

2+ years of experience with unit Testing frameworks such as Junit, Mockito, and BDD testing tools like Selenium

1+ years of experience with Docker containerization, Kubernetes etc.

1+ years of experience with CI/CD tools like Harness, Jenkins, Circle CI etc.











Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience

Title: Remote AS400/Synon Application Developer
Job_Description:
IT Developer:
CVS Health has a dynamic opportunity for an IT Developer to join our dedicated PBM Align for Profit (AFP) initiative. The department’s mission is to provide best-in-class business to technology services to the PBM Finance Organization. As the IT Developer, you will be responsible for items that include building out database model logic, transformations, and analytic reports for end-users and key financial stake holders.

The ideal candidate should demonstrate a solid knowledge of the PBM business and be able to provide examples of providing solutions to problems. This role is results oriented. You must be able to coordinate and work seamlessly with the team to produce the best possible end-user and stakeholder experience. The candidate will be expected to adhere to departmental SDLC methods, best practices and change management to ensure quality standards are met and maintained. You will also be identifying cause and effect relationships to challenge strategic assumptions and provide insight for decision making. The IT Developer must be a self-starter who is comfortable in a dynamic team environment with experienced technical peers.

Additionally, you will need a clear understanding of the systems and data locations to extract, measure, track and recommend potential opportunities for performance improvement. The role requires experience with improving the quality of imperfect data to produce reporting that leads to actionable results. A perpetual desire to develop a deeper understanding of the PBM business as well as the improving your technical skillset will be needed in order to fulfill the requirements in this role.

Title: Remote AS400/Synon Application Developer
Job_Description:
CVS Health’s mandate is to transform health and wellness via products that enable consumer engagement and best-in-class experience. This team is responsible for CVS Health’s digital transformation and all digital products; as well as the development and execution of the digital roadmap. A key part of the responsibility is to build an integrated platform that enables the delivery of products to drive engagement and revolutionize health and wellness. We want you to be a part of the team that will build this next generation platform. Leveraging your expertise in Big Data, IoT, Native Cloud, Application Development, Machine Learning and Deep Learning, you will join a product team that is building disruptive cloud platform that will transform the healthcare industry and improve the lives of hundreds of millions of people.

CVS Health Digital is a highly energetic, highly collaborative team that operates as a startup within the CVS Health Enterprise. We want you to bring your talent and expertise to drive the change that is desperately needed within the healthcare industry. Come Join CVS Health Digital!

We are looking for expert experience in full stack development, frameworks, unit testing frameworks. You will partner with product managers and the scrum team to effectively translate the business requirements in Node.JS/React/JavaScript/Java. Demonstrates ability to remove problems and overcome roadblocks during the project.

Key Responsibilities:

Great written and verbal communication skills

Experience translating feature requests into working software

An open mind about different solutions and a willingness to discuss alternatives

Willingness to work within a cohesive team environment that emphasizes a culture of teaching and learning

You will be actively contributing in designing & developing applications/services using advanced technologies, and CI/CD processes.

You should have the ability prioritize tasks well, and to communicate clearly. You must be able to work across multiple facets of the project and juggle multiple responsibilities at the same time

Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 60,000
Maximum: 128,700

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


3+ years of experience with programming languages/tools including Java, NodeJS, Python, Go, JavaScript and Shell Scripts.
3+ years of experience with emerging platforms such as, Linux and open source technologies.
3+ years of experience with build automation technologies, preferably Jenkins
3+ years of experienced in CI/CD and operationalized distributed and highly scalable & available cloud applications.
3+ years of experience in partnering with architecture, product and program management teams to influence product development assisting or improving products.


3+ years of expert knowledge working with XML, JSON, HTML, CSS and Java Script.
3+ years of working experience in using libraries, tools, and frameworks such as: Nodejs, Angular, Underscore, jQuery, Bootstrap.
Good understanding of framework code and methods of component architecture.
A track record of writing clean, high quality, high performing, scalable code.
Disciplined approach to testing and quality assurance.
Strong troubleshooting skills.
Working experience of CI/CD pipeline, GIT, or Jenkins.
Experience with SAFe Agile.
Experience in web security.
Experience working with distributed systems.
Experience in test driven development
Thrive in a fast-paced environment.


Bachelors degree or equivalent years of experience

3+ years of experience with agile development
SAFe Agile experienced preferred
Experience with IBM Sterling OMS will be Preferred.
Healthcare industry knowledge


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent years of experience

Job_Description:
Aetna Resources LLC, a CVS Health company, is hiring for the following role in Burlington, MA: Advanced Software Development Engineer to design and develop enterprise software applications and platforms. Duties include: analyze user needs and develop software solutions to meet business requirements; determine feasibility of solutions design and prepare technical design documentation; upgrade existing software applications and/or systems to improve functionality and features with a focus on performance, reliability, and maintainability; develop and deploy application components, and support unit testing and bug fixes; participate in AGILE Scrum meetings and/or CI/CD; support applications, systems, and databases used to process prescriptions, claims, and related healthcare activities; and collaborate with cross-functional teams on applications development, technical requirements, code review, project deliverables, quality assurance, and software development best practices. Up to 50% telecommuting available.

Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Systems Engineering, Engineering or related field and four (4) years of experience with each of the following: Kotlin programming; Modern software development frameworks; Mobile applications development; MVP and Clean Architecture; Accessibility development; Agile methodologies or SAFe Software Development Principles; and CI/CD, Jenkins, GIT, or DevOps.


See Required Qualifications.


See Required Qualifications.

Title: Remote AS400/Synon Application Developer
Job_Description:
As a Full stack developer within our team at CVS Health, you will participate and lead in application development and application maintenance & support for Java technology stack applications with the team.

As an individual contributor & a team player, you will help the team to effectively deliver the projects on-time and with quality.

A firm understanding of Java development principles and agile methodologies is crucial for success in the role.

This position is available local to Buffalo Grove, IL or Dallas, TX preferably and is work from home flexible. You also must be able to provide effective 24x7 production support as needed.

Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 75,000
Maximum: 167,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


o 2+ years of Java development experience while utilizing one or more these technologies: Spring Boot, Java, Spring MVC, Angular, JPA, REST APIs, MySQL.
o 1+ year of experience working in an Agile based development environment, using Agile concepts such as Continuous Integration, CI/CD, TDD (GitHub, Jenkins).




Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience required.

*** WFH Flexible, IL***

CVS Health is currently hiring for an Application Developer (Java Coding) to join our team! Title: Remote AS400/Synon Application Developer
Job_Description:
As a Senior Java FullStack Software Engineer with CVS Health Platform Innovation, you will participate on an XP Programming Product Team of 6-10 people and work with the team to build high quality, usable products to customers and stakeholders in our new innovation labs. You will help educate both business and technology personnel on the agile and XP development process and create products from discovery and framework through iterative development and delivery. You will also maintain a user-centered and business as priority approach in design perspective and practice.

A firm understanding of Java development principles and agile methodologies is crucial for success in the role. The position is located in the Buffalo Grove, IL office. Candidates must be able to work in a hybrid model that will depend on product specific requirements: new efforts may be in person for a few weeks – through MVP (minimum viable product)

Title: Software Development Engineer
Job_Description:
CVS Health Digital is looking for hands-on, passionate people who want to join a high energy and growing team to make a difference in customers’ lives and who want to be on the
forefront of digital innovation that aims to reinvent what a pharmacy and a health care company can be in the digital world.
This role includes closely working with a team of engineers to drive delivery excellence, partner with business and other
IT leaders to build digital assets, provide expert level support to resolve complex issues and provide RCA,
identify gaps in systems in current digital eco system and provide solutions to enhance overall performance.
All of this is critical to driving Digital growth and improving customer experience.
This individual will collaborate with digital leaders, business partners, and IT colleagues to deliver business growth and great customer experiences
that differentiate CVS in the market, while ensuring efficient, effective and SAFe development.


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 75,000
Maximum: 167,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


5+ years of overall Software/Digital development experience

5+ years of microservices, cloud native applications development and web development experience using tools such as React JS, CSS, Java/J2EE, Spring Framework, NodeJS, Messaging Frameworks (i.e, Kafka/Rabbit MQ), NoSQL/RDBMS databases (i.e, Mongo DB, PostgresSQL, Redis), and other tech stacks (Open source and proprietary)

2+ years of experience with unit Testing frameworks such as Junit, Mockito, and BDD testing tools like Selenium

1+ years of experience with Docker containerization, Kubernetes etc.

1+ years of experience with CI/CD tools like Harness, Jenkins, Circle CI etc.











Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience

Title: Software Development Engineer
Job_Description:
A11y Engineer is responsible for supporting and equipping our Product Design and Engineering teams to ensure successful delivery of our accessible digital products. This person will be supporting all aspects of integrating accessibility into design and deployment:

Responsibilities
Partner with Accessibility Design team in building A11y into Product Design by:
o helping understand how users experience products using Assistive Technology
o participating in and contribute in Accessible Design Decisions
o identifying how design intent affects A11y AC (Acceptance Criteria)
Partner with Engineering teams during development and testing ensuring A11y AC is being met by:
o ensuring feature functionality has A11y AC written / available
o helping engineers understand the A11y AC.
o answering technical how-to questions for A11y in Web, IOS & Android development.
o helping engineers test and validate A11y AC.
o helping understand how users experience products using Assistive Technology
o helping understand what to test for and how to test to ensure feature functionality meets A11y AC (Acceptance Criteria).
o manually testing key feature functionality to ensure A11y AC is met.
o reviewing 3rd-Party findings, test results
o re-test, verify reported findings if reported issue is questionable
o create A11y user stories, defects for A11y findings
o help triage, prioritize A11y issues with product and provide A11y context, guidance on how to remediate A11y findings.
o training opportunities
o engineering methods needing correction
o components needing a11y refinements
o processes lacking appropriate a11y support.

Unicorn Responsibilities


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 75,000
Maximum: 167,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.






Bachelors preferred

H.S diploma required with experience

Title: Software Development Engineer
Job_Description:
CVS Pharmacy, Inc., a CVS Health company, is hiring for the following role in Buffalo Grove, IL: Digital Development Engineer to Design and develop digital software applications and platforms. Duties include: analyze user needs and develop software solutions to meet business requirements; determine feasibility of solutions design and prepare technical design documentation; upgrade existing software applications and/or systems to improve functionality and features with a focus on performance, reliability, and maintainability; write and review high quality code and perform unit and/or automation testing; support applications, systems, and databases used to process prescriptions, claims, and related healthcare activities; collaborate with cross-functional teams on applications development, technical requirements, code review, project deliverables, quality assurance, and software development best practices; and mentor junior team members.

Required Qualifications
Master’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Digital Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field and two (2) years of experience in each of the following: Java, Python, or Node.js; XML, JSON, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript; Agile methodologies or SAFe Software Development Principles; Frameworks: Angular, jQuery, Ajax, and Bootstrap; Typescript and objected-oriented JavaScript; REST, SOAP, or Web Service APIs; JIRA, Rally, or Confluence; Software development for enterprise or web applications; Writing clean, high quality, high performing, scalable code; Testing, quality assurance, and troubleshooting; and Software development lifecycle.

Job_Description:
As the Senior Security Engineer on our team, you will work very closely with security applications and more specifically our penetration testing program, red teaming, dynamic application security testing program, as well as our broader application security program.
You will be part of an experienced team of skilled penetration testers. You’ll participate in all phases of penetration testing as well as other individual and team-based work all focused on the information security of our enterprise. This is an exciting opportunity for an appropriately experienced penetration tester.

In this opportunity you will also:
Protect money movement, Healthcare and other sensitive consumer information.
Be a part of transforming Healthcare in America.
Be a part of expanding opportunities to test Application Programming Interfaces (APIs), cloud, Industrial Control Systems (ICS), web tags, and Internet of Things (IoT).

As a Lead Data Engineer, you will collaborate with business partners in Sales & Marketing Analytics to identity opportunities to leverage big data technologies with a common set of tools and infrastructure to make analytics faster, more insightful, and more efficient. You will use your skills in building data pipelines and knowledge of App Dev to enable data integration, data management, and analysis of massive data sets from multiple channels.

Responsibilities:
Designs and develops complex and large-scale data structures and pipelines to organize, collect and standardize data to generate insights and addresses reporting needs
Leads a team of onshore/offshore consultants to build out/maintain web applications
Designs/problem solves web applications
Writes complex ETL (Extract / Transform / Load) processes, designs database systems and develops tools for real-time and offline analytic processing

Title: Lead UX Designer
Job_Description:
As a Lead UX Product Designer, you will be an integral part of an innovative and bold initiative that takes a modern approach of disciplined agile and lean software practices aimed at transforming healthcare and pharmacy. The Lead UX Product Designer is essential to ensuring product success and end-user satisfaction in a highly collaborative environment that often follows the Extreme Programming (XP) methodology. The Lead UX Product Designer position is responsible for leading the design effort by making informed decisions for product development as part of small, cross-functional product teams. You will help educate both business and technology teams on the XP process and how the traditional UX role changes, as well as lead products from discovery through iterative delivery while maintaining a user-centered approach in design perspective and practice. You will also be responsible for coaching and mentoring other product designers within the practice team.

A firm understanding of user-centered design principles and user research methodologies is crucial for success in the role. Empathy, creative problem-solving, comfort with uncertainty, pairing with team members, excellent communication skills, curiosity and learning are the foundational characteristics of the UX Product Designer. The position is located in the Irving TX, Buffalo Grove IL or Scottsdale AZ offices, and candidates must be able to be in the office as needed to work with their product team.

Additional responsibilities of the UX Product Designer include:
Solve the right problem through the understanding of user needs in order to deliver new or improved products and services that have real impact
Bring a lean/iterative mindset; be open to having conversations over documentation
Full-stack designer: assist with all dimensions of design – research, usability evaluation, information architecture, wireframes, visual, CSS and HTML – it’s ok not be an expert in all, as long as you are open and want to learn
Ability to mentor, coach and guide other designers in an XP lab (this is an individual contributor role with leadership responsibilities)
Work with cross-functional teams and pair with everyone – other designers, product managers, and product engineers
Embrace an agile mindset: be willing to adapt and experiment with design process

Title: Lead UX Designer
Job_Description:
As a UX Product Designer, you will be an integral part of an innovative and bold initiative that takes a modern approach of disciplined agile and lean software practices aimed at transforming healthcare and pharmacy. The UX Product Designer is essential to ensuring product success and end-user satisfaction in a highly collaborative environment that follows the Extreme Programming (XP) methodology. The UX Product Designer position is responsible for taking a user-centered approach to design in finding the right solution for users as part of small, cross-functional product teams. You will help educate both business and technology teams on the XP process and how the traditional UX role changes, as well as lead products from discovery through iterative delivery.

A firm understanding of user-centered design principles and user research methodologies is crucial for success in the role. Empathy, creative problem-solving, comfort with uncertainty, pairing with team members, excellent communication skills, curiosity and learning are the foundational characteristics of the UX Product Designer. Candidates must be able to work in a hybrid model that will depend on product specific requirements: new efforts may be in person for a few weeks – through MVP (minimum viable product).

Additional responsibilities of the UX Product Designer include:

Solve the right problem through the understanding of user needs in order to deliver new or improved products and services that have real impact

Bring a lean/iterative mindset; be open to having conversations over documentation

Full-stack designer: assist with all dimensions of design – research, usability evaluation, information architecture, wireframes, visual, CSS and HTML – it’s ok not be an expert in all, as long as you are open and want to learn

Work with cross-functional teams and pair with everyone – other designers, product managers, and product engineers

Embrace an agile mindset: be willing to adapt and experiment with design process

Stay up to date on UX/UI design industry best practices and trends


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 75,000
Maximum: 167,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


5+ years’ professional experience as a UX Architect, UX Designer, or Product Designer role.

2+ years’ experience in at least one of the 3 design pillars: user research, interaction design or visual design.

1+ years of working effectively with Agile and lean philosophies

1+ years’ experience working independently with clients or stakeholder and designing business or enterprise applications

1+ years’ experience executing user-centered design methodologies by leading product design decisions from research through implementation

1+ years’ experience working in design and prototyping software tools such as Figma, Sketch, Axure or InVision

1+ year of experience with modern front-end technologies and open-source frameworks (e.g., Material Design, HTML/CSS, grid systems, responsive design)


Experience with UX design advocacy within large business and technology organizations

Exceptional written, verbal, and visual communication skills along with a strong work ethic

Ability to rapidly prototype

Willingness to present on design topics internally

Knowledge of the pharmacy and healthcare industries

Knowledge of cloud-based technology platforms


Bachelor's Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Fine Arts, Computer Science or Similar. Equivalent years of experience in lieu of degree considered.

Title: Lead UX Designer
Job_Description:
Position Summary:

We are looking for a Senior Experience Designer to support our Aetna Health product.

Aetna Health is our primary member-facing product for anyone who has coverage through Aetna, focused on helping them get the most out of their plan. Members can check their coverage, review claims and spending, find doctors, pull up their ID card, get tips on saving money and staying healthy, and much more. Aetna Health is delivered on multiple platforms (responsive Web, iOS, and Android), and has millions of active users across our commercial, Medicare, and individual market member populations.

You’ll work alongside talented and passionate teammates from diverse backgrounds. Together, you’ll identify customer problems or opportunities, develop the strategic UX vision, and communicate that narrative across the business. You’ll guide cross-functional teams through a user-centered design approach, culminating in the execution of member experiences that validate the strategy, hypotheses, and business/user goal.

What You’ll Do:

Collaborate with product management, business and technology partners to ensure a shared understanding of business goals, user needs, and success criteria.

Develop a working knowledge of customer journeys, personas and segmentation within your portfolio of value streams.

Utilize user-centered design approaches to define the customer problem / opportunity with cross-functional teams

Develop concepts, wireframes, and prototypes, through facilitation and hands-on work

Partner with accessibility, research, and content strategy resources to ensure solutions meet the needs of all users

Produce high-fidelity UI deliverables for engineering handoff and collaborate with engineering to ensure design quality in the final product

Iterate on design solutions based on research and analytics/metrics

Collaborate with other design teams to drive the evolution of our design system and ensure consistency across our product and other products across the enterprise


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 75,000
Maximum: 167,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.













Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience

Title: Lead UX Designer
Job_Description:
The Product Design Senior Manager ensures the successful execution of agile user-centered design on digital products / apps and strategic initiatives in an information technology (IT) department. As part of the Enterprise Product Acceleration organization, you will be part of a leadership team that is driving lean UX methods as part of cross-functional product teams that follow the Extreme Programming (XP) delivery method with a broader enterprise influence. You will coordinate team or group activities with CVS Health resources. You will provide guidance and direction to product teams and direct reports on planning and execution of products, technical and functional standards and practice, process and procedures and career development. You will participate in annual budgeting, capital processes and quality improvement activities for the organization. The position location is based either the Irving TX, Buffalo Grove IL or Scottsdale AZ offices, and candidates should have flexibility to be in the office to work with their product team when conditions support it.

Title: Senior Full Stack Security Engineer
Job_Description:
CVS Health Digital is looking for a Senior Full Stack Security Engineer who is passionate about designing and building secure platforms and applications. The ideal candidate will feel comfortable working with both front-end and back-end application developers, as well as in building, automating and securing on-premise as well as cloud based applications, preferably on the Google Cloud Platform(GCP).

The selected candidate will be working with a strong team to help transform the way systems are built, secured, authorized and securely operated for continuous compliance and risk mitigation. Specifically, this candidate will help lead efforts to implement security patterns and practices with orchestration and automation tools that automate the secure configuration, verification, compliance and authorization of systems. They will be a key member of a team tasked with maturing the organization’s software development and security practices.

Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 95,000
Maximum: 209,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.






BS in Computer Science or equivalent years of experience

As one of our Agile Development Managers, you will be part of a dynamic and evolving team of developers working in a SAFe Agile Development environment. Achieves organization goals by being deliberate and resourceful in leading people and balancing priorities, risks and expenses to successfully manage, build, and operationalize on a portfolio of digital products and capabilities. Well versed with agile development practices, this leader will deliver high quality software to enhance customer experiences and is expected to drive vision, innovation and strategic plans that help advance CVS Health’s Digital enterprise solutions across our Personalization and health services portfolios.


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 95,000
Maximum: 209,000

Title: Senior Full Stack Security Engineer
Job_Description:
CVS Health Digital is looking for a dynamic and driven Sr. Software Engineering Manager to lead Backend engineering teams tasked with creating best in class experiences focused on identifying, prioritizing and shaping complex enterprise initiatives in partnership with business stakeholders. In this role, you will be leading a team of engineers to drive the delivery of our digital products focused on helping people live healthier lives. You will use your people management skills to support, manage and mentor engineering professionals with deep and varying technical backgrounds and experience. You should have the ability to prioritize well, communicate clearly, have a consistent track record of delivery and excellent software engineering and people management skills. A successful candidate will be a highly motivated, collaborative individual; motivated to achieve results in a fast-paced environment.

In this role, you will review tech designs, hire new development staff, oversee each aspect of the development process, and act as the liaison between your team and upper management

Title: Senior Full Stack Security Engineer
Job_Description:
CVS Health Digital is looking for a Senior Full Stack Security Engineer who is passionate about designing and building secure platforms and applications. The ideal candidate will feel comfortable working with both front-end and back-end application developers, as well as in building, automating and securing on-premise as well as cloud based applications, preferably on the Google Cloud Platform(GCP).

The selected candidate will be working with a strong team to help transform the way systems are built, secured, authorized and securely operated for continuous compliance and risk mitigation. Specifically, this candidate will help lead efforts to implement security patterns and practices with orchestration and automation tools that automate the secure configuration, verification, compliance and authorization of systems. They will be a key member of a team tasked with maturing the organization’s software development and security practices.

Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 95,000
Maximum: 209,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.






BS in Computer Science or equivalent years of experience

Title: Manager, Project Management (IC) - Fully Remote
Job_Description:
The Manager/Scrum Master is responsible for providing program/project oversight, day-to-day management, leadership, direction, and administration across the full project lifecycle (team formation, planning, requirements, design, build, test, deployment, and warranty support) on medium to large size/complexity projects. The Manager/Scrum Master will work with Business and IT teams to ensure that all managed projects fully comply with CVS Health PMO project management methodology standards, approved business requirements, and time/cost commitments while maintaining the highest levels of business and user satisfaction. The Manager/Scrum Master will also provide support and guidance to less senior team members.

MANAGEMENT SCOPE
The Manager/Scrum Master will manage project teams of 5 to 40+ indirect/matrix reports, consisting of CVS Health and non-CVS Health employees. The Manager/Scrum Master, requiring minimal supervision, will be responsible for effectively managing team/stakeholder expectations and engagement through clear communication of roles and responsibilities and regular status updates. The Manager/Scrum Master is also responsible for providing timely feedback and written project reviews for each CVS Health indirect report.

ACCOUNTABILITY:
Management of assigned projects including team formation and management, plan creation (scope, schedule, and budget), and project execution. Deliver all assigned projects in full compliance with CVS Health project management methodology standards and KPI, and as documented in formal project requirements, on-time, on-budget, and with high quality. Effective relationship management with IT functional and business teams that contributes to the reputation of the PMO. Skilled delegation and leadership by example to help CVS Health develop our people to their full potential while delivering top performance. Ensuring project purchasing, infrastructure, and other less common needs are met through proactive engagement of special support teams and in compliance with PMO process standards.

1. Ensure that all projects are delivered on time, within scope, within budget, and in full compliance of CVS Health PMO project management methodology and KPI requirements.
2. Produce regular and thorough stakeholder communications
3.Assist in the definition and documentation of project scope ensuring all relevant SME’s are engaged to produce competent and comprehensive functional and non-functional requirements.
4. Produce a detailed project plan and monitor and control activities to remain on plan.
5. Manage resource availability, allocation, and project financials.
6. Manage changes to scope, schedule, and cost in compliance with PMO project management methodology and processes.
7. Perform risk management assessment and ongoing review and mitigation.
8. Work within scope of authority to resolve project issues escalating when necessary.
9. Ensure required project artifacts are completed in compliance with PMO process and stored in the project repository.
10. Excellent written and verbal skills.
11. Strong management, team, and stakeholder communication and conflict resolution skills.
12. Experience working with multiple teams, delegating work, and ensuring team efficiency.
13. Demonstrated experience resolving complex business problems/issues/risks.
14. Ability to work with business users, understand their needs, and translate such into final project deliverables.
15. Ability to work with technical resources, understand their needs and coordinate their efforts to deliver the final project solution.


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 75,000
Maximum: 167,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


5+ years of successful Program/Project Management experience with medium to large scale projects.


- Health care, insurance, or pharmacy experience is a plus - Understanding of project and software development methodologies such as Agile, Scrum etc.


Bachelor's degree required

Title: Manager, Project Management (IC) - Fully Remote
Job_Description:
As a Senior Business Project Manager at bswift, you will oversee the implementation of information strategy and development of information products to ensure operational objectives, business priorities, product implementations and other strategic business initiatives are met. Furthermore, you will be responsible for managing multiple projects and ensuring day-to-day project activities run smoothly. bswift offers software and services that streamline benefits, HR and payroll administration for employers and public and private exchanges nationwide. bswift’s state-of-the-art cloud-based technology and outsourcing solutions significantly reduce administrative costs and time-consuming paperwork, making life easier for administrators and millions of consumers who enroll in benefits with bswift.

The Senior Business Project Manager position is responsible for Project and Product Management accountabilities such as project oversight including initiation, identification, and completion of key deliverables to ensure all business objectives are met. Also, you will develop tactical plans to satisfy internal program information needs and is responsible for the success of the project(s). Title: Manager, Project Management (IC) - Fully Remote
Job_Description:
*Fully Remote* - prefer Downers Grove area

This position will exist within the TPA & Payer Solutions IT organization . The immediate need is aligned but not limited to the Wholesale Lines of Business within the TPA & Payer Solutions IT Department to include American Health Holding, First Health and Aetna Signature Administrators.

This role will manage the day-to-day activities of one or multiple complex business-sponsored IT projects (of which total cost of projects under management concurrently exceed $1 million) to deliver tasks on time, within budget, and within scope. Responsible for the success of the project(s).

This position will also play a role in leading the transformation of the IT program delivery capabilities within the Wholesale Organization. Transformation will be inclusive of the adoption of SAFe, Lean Agile and DevOp practices.

Responsibilities:

Consistently responsible for managing, directing and planning complex projects consisting of one or more project teams. Ability to communicate and effectively negotiate with business, sr. management, peers with a high level of confidence and composure.

Provides coaching and team building to ensure that the project team members develop their skills and achieve their career goals. Leads a matrixed project team in executing assigned tasks and coordinating the efforts of internal and external project team members.

Ensures that project team members complete tasks and deliverables on time and within budget, and that the project delivers promised business functionality. Identifies and capitalizes on interdependencies within the project(s) to ensure end-to-end synergy during all phases of the project life cycle.

Develops and manages all key project governance documents, such as but not limited to the Project Charter, Workplan, Communications Plan, and Risk Mitigation Strategy Manages to the project budget, and reports project cost information in an accurate and timely manner.

Proactively identifies additional cost-savings to reduce overall project expenditures. Manages the effective utilization of resources assigned to the project team, and proactively communicates resource capacity and shortages to the respective organization leads.

Coordinates engagement of subject matter experts in the business segment to assist in the identification, validation, and resolution of business system needs.

Acts as the liaison between project team members and Program Management Manager to ensure that expectations and objectives are clearly understood by all parties, and to communicate project information including the status of deliverables, scope changes, and issues.

Proactively evaluates project activities, builds contingency plans, executes corrective action, and monitors issue resolution to mitigate risks such as scope and/or budget variances.

Manages the scope of the project, and ensures that scope changes are reviewed and approved by Finance and Business Sponsor where appropriate.

Evaluates project activities utilizing quality measurements and monitoring mechanisms to ensure that deliverables meet or exceed expectations and integrate with overall project effort.

Monitors and reports tangible and intangible benefits. Provides management with team and individual performance feedback.

Adheres to existing project management methodology by leveraging and promoting the use of existing tools, capturing best practices, identifying areas for process improvement, and the associated implementation.

Monitors and holds project resources accountable for meeting performance metrics Creates and maintains a highly collaborative PM community of practice that drives and implements continuous improvements which result in IT and Business Return on Investment.

Act as a role model for other Project Managers, as well as being an active mentor to other Project Managers Partners and collaborates with the Business in building a strong foundational knowledge of the Business processes to deliver the appropriate IT Business solution Prepares and delivers professional presentations to management and business


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 75,400
Maximum: 158,300

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


3+ years experience with agile and devOp Delivery Methodology Experience

3+ years team leadership Experience


SAFe Certifications
Project Management Institute (PMI) certification.
CVS Health Knowledge
SIM Regional Leadership Forum Graduate
Capacity Management Experience
Strategic Planning and Goal Setting Experience
Healthcare Industry Experience
Program Budget Management Experience


Bachelor degree from accredited higher education institution.
MBA preferred.

Title: Manager, Project Management (IC) - Fully Remote
Job_Description:
The Manager/Scrum Master is responsible for providing program/project oversight, day-to-day management, leadership, direction, and administration across the full project lifecycle (team formation, planning, requirements, design, build, test, deployment, and warranty support) on medium to large size/complexity projects. The Manager/Scrum Master will work with Business and IT teams to ensure that all managed projects fully comply with CVS Health PMO project management methodology standards, approved business requirements, and time/cost commitments while maintaining the highest levels of business and user satisfaction. The Manager/Scrum Master will also provide support and guidance to less senior team members.

MANAGEMENT SCOPE
The Manager/Scrum Master will manage project teams of 5 to 40+ indirect/matrix reports, consisting of CVS Health and non-CVS Health employees. The Manager/Scrum Master, requiring minimal supervision, will be responsible for effectively managing team/stakeholder expectations and engagement through clear communication of roles and responsibilities and regular status updates. The Manager/Scrum Master is also responsible for providing timely feedback and written project reviews for each CVS Health indirect report.

ACCOUNTABILITY:
Management of assigned projects including team formation and management, plan creation (scope, schedule, and budget), and project execution. Deliver all assigned projects in full compliance with CVS Health project management methodology standards and KPI, and as documented in formal project requirements, on-time, on-budget, and with high quality. Effective relationship management with IT functional and business teams that contributes to the reputation of the PMO. Skilled delegation and leadership by example to help CVS Health develop our people to their full potential while delivering top performance. Ensuring project purchasing, infrastructure, and other less common needs are met through proactive engagement of special support teams and in compliance with PMO process standards.

1. Ensure that all projects are delivered on time, within scope, within budget, and in full compliance of CVS Health PMO project management methodology and KPI requirements.
2. Produce regular and thorough stakeholder communications
3.Assist in the definition and documentation of project scope ensuring all relevant SME’s are engaged to produce competent and comprehensive functional and non-functional requirements.
4. Produce a detailed project plan and monitor and control activities to remain on plan.
5. Manage resource availability, allocation, and project financials.
6. Manage changes to scope, schedule, and cost in compliance with PMO project management methodology and processes.
7. Perform risk management assessment and ongoing review and mitigation.
8. Work within scope of authority to resolve project issues escalating when necessary.
9. Ensure required project artifacts are completed in compliance with PMO process and stored in the project repository.
10. Excellent written and verbal skills.
11. Strong management, team, and stakeholder communication and conflict resolution skills.
12. Experience working with multiple teams, delegating work, and ensuring team efficiency.
13. Demonstrated experience resolving complex business problems/issues/risks.
14. Ability to work with business users, understand their needs, and translate such into final project deliverables.
15. Ability to work with technical resources, understand their needs and coordinate their efforts to deliver the final project solution.


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 75,000
Maximum: 167,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


5+ years of successful Program/Project Management experience with medium to large scale projects.


- Health care, insurance, or pharmacy experience is a plus - Understanding of project and software development methodologies such as Agile, Scrum etc.


Bachelor's degree required

Title: Manager, Project Management (IC) - Fully Remote
Job_Description:
The UM Automation is a business team managing the implementation of strategic initiatives for the UM Clinical Services organization. These initiatives use technical capabilities such as artificial intelligence, rules engines, predictive analytics and robotics to automate UM transactions, deploy workflow efficiencies, and improve provider and member experiences. This position will be a Scaled Agile Product Owner in this team. They will be responsible for owning more than 1 features from conception to delivery. They will work with the business to understand the feature objectives, and also with architecture and IT teams to decompose features into user stories and acceptance criteria. This will include creation of requirements documentation, including business process flows or outcome diagrams. They own the team's backlog. They prepare and execute PI planning, refine the stories, create definition of done, attend demos from team, provide demos to stakeholders, accept stories, and participate in team retrospective. They will need to prepare regular governance updates to keep program management up-to-date of progress and issues.

Title: Manager, Project Management (IC) - Fully Remote
Job_Description:
This is a product owner role on an Agile Team accountable for the development, implementation and ongoing management of multiple projects. This person will lead discussions with stakeholders, gather and document requirements, validate and demo logic functionality keeping management informed of project status through go live.

Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 60,300
Maximum: 126,600

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


Demonstrated ability to manage multiple business functions/projects
Strong analytical skills
Strong collaboration skills
Excellent time management skills
Strong writing skills
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively; including problem resolution and escalating project risks


1-2 Years Product Owner Experience
Agile Framework knowledge
270/271 and/or 834, 837 file experience


5+ Years of experience or Bachelor's Degree

Title: Manager, Project Management (IC) - Fully Remote
Job_Description:
As an API Technical Delivery Lead, you will be responsible for providing multiple concurrent API solutions and driving the end-to-end delivery of small/medium projects (up to 2500 hours). You will implement the Proof-of-Concept, review projects for compliance to service guideline and implement new service patterns under the guidance of a Senior Advisor. You will also lead application support for medium/low impact events (P3/Welcome Season/general support).

Your responsibilities will include:
Analyzing and correcting complex system issues and sharing expertise across multiple teams
Assisting in establishment and adherence to technical direction, standards (security & compliance), guidelines and methodology for use in specified technologies within your own discipline
Serving as a mentor to lower-level technological resources on the team


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 75,000
Maximum: 167,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


5+ years of IT development experience including the following:




Bachelor's Degree required, Master's degree preferred

Title: Manager, Project Management (IC) - Fully Remote
Job_Description:
** Ideally remote work in the following states: TX, IL and RI**

The CVS Health PMO team is looking for an innovative thought partner who has a strong analytic and program management skill set to serve as a key contributor on critical IT programs. This role will require an out-of-the-box problem solver who is intellectually curious with a demonstrated interest in learning, self-motivated, results-oriented, and high-energy who can easily function in a high demand, performance driven environment. This position will be responsible to independently drive planning and day to day management across the full project lifecycle on complex IT initiatives and programs, working closely with project teams to achieve expected results.

You will support the planning, coordination and tactical execution of IT projects and programs across business and functional areas, as well as the development of presentations and content for key leadership forums. The role offers significant exposure to cross-functional leaders and colleagues across CVS Health and Aetna, as well as professional development opportunities. Assignments are highly complex, have major associated risks with high visibility, and can be sensitive or widely varied requiring experience in applying and adapting project management techniques.

Areas of responsibility include:


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 95,000
Maximum: 209,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.






High School Diploma/GED plus years of experience in lieu of Bachelor’s Degree required

Bachelor’s Degree preferred

Title: Manager, Project Management (IC) - Fully Remote
Job_Description:
As a Lead Director of Project Program Management, you will be part of the Clinical Platform Solutions Data Exchange and Engagement team driving large enterprise business and system initiatives that focus on streamlining data ingestion and use by clinical care teams to improve the member experience.

This role will have an affinity for collaboration, negotiation, and coordination among Information Technology (IT) teams and clinical/non-clinical operations within Utilization Management, Care Management, and Quality Management, driving towards strategic direction and objectives.

Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 100,000
Maximum: 221,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


Provide oversight and strategic direction on technology initiatives to achieve clinical business roadmap/vision.

Influence stakeholders and leadership to ensure positive outcomes that deliver on results.

Identify gaps and recommend new ideas to enhance new and existing products and workflows based on a broad view of the organization.

Identify and drive process improvements and automation of manual processes.

Use influence to improve performance results, organization effectiveness, and quality of systems.

Collaborate with stakeholders to obtain agreement on scope and high-level solution.

Define requirements that support strategic objectives and articulate what success means.

Partner with IT teams to connect business needs to technology solutions.

Evaluate data needs and willingness to understand and probe into technical details.

Collaborate with cross-functional areas to understand and articulate data flow across systems including key integration points and surfacing of data to the care team.

Join forces with functional managers and other business areas to ensure all workflow processes and interdependencies are identified and addressed.

Lead business program management responsibilities including but not limited to building comprehensive delivery plan, tracking progress, and providing regular status updates.

Optimize team performance by understanding dependencies, risks, and ability to resolve barriers to success.

Obtain financial support for projects and monitor budget, raising awareness if over/under spending.

Excellent verbal and written communications skills


10+ years or more of managed care / health insurance experience

Minimum 5 years of experience in Project Management and/or managing projects end to end

Minimum 5 years of experience in Technology

Multiple years proven leadership experience setting strategic direction and influencing change that resulted in quantifiable positive outcomes.

Strong organization skills and excellent verbal/written communications skills

At least 1 year of experience utilizing Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) methodology

Basic understanding of Health Information Technologies

Good understanding of CVS Health and its various business units

Understanding of Health Information Exchanges (HIE’s) and Electronic Health Record (EHRs)

Some experience in provider or network management

Strong analytics/data visualization skills

Demonstrated ability to navigate through ambiguity and provide a structured problem-solving approach

Strong attention to detail and a focus on mobilizing the organization to deliver the strategy.


BS/BA or equivalent experience and 8-10 years of experience related to technology, systems, bidirectional exchange of data, project or data vendor management.

This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Title: Manager, Project Management (IC) - Fully Remote
Job_Description:
** Ideally remote work in the following states: TX, IL and RI**

The CVS Health PMO team is looking for an innovative thought partner who has a strong analytic and program management skill set to serve as a key contributor on critical IT programs. This role will require an out-of-the-box problem solver who is intellectually curious with a demonstrated interest in learning, self-motivated, results-oriented, and high-energy who can easily function in a high demand, performance driven environment. This position will be responsible to independently drive planning and day to day management across the full project lifecycle on complex IT initiatives and programs, working closely with project teams to achieve expected results.

You will support the planning, coordination and tactical execution of IT projects and programs across business and functional areas, as well as the development of presentations and content for key leadership forums. The role offers significant exposure to cross-functional leaders and colleagues across CVS Health and Aetna, as well as professional development opportunities. Assignments are highly complex, have major associated risks with high visibility, and can be sensitive or widely varied requiring experience in applying and adapting project management techniques.

Title: Manager, Project Management (IC) - Fully Remote
Job_Description:
As a Lead Director of Project Program Management, you will be part of the Clinical Platform Solutions Data Exchange and Engagement team driving large enterprise business and system initiatives that focus on streamlining data ingestion and use by clinical care teams to improve the member experience.

This role will have an affinity for collaboration, negotiation, and coordination among Information Technology (IT) teams and clinical/non-clinical operations within Utilization Management, Care Management, and Quality Management, driving towards strategic direction and objectives.

Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 100,000
Maximum: 221,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


Provide oversight and strategic direction on technology initiatives to achieve clinical business roadmap/vision.

Influence stakeholders and leadership to ensure positive outcomes that deliver on results.

Identify gaps and recommend new ideas to enhance new and existing products and workflows based on a broad view of the organization.

Identify and drive process improvements and automation of manual processes.

Use influence to improve performance results, organization effectiveness, and quality of systems.

Collaborate with stakeholders to obtain agreement on scope and high-level solution.

Define requirements that support strategic objectives and articulate what success means.

Partner with IT teams to connect business needs to technology solutions.

Evaluate data needs and willingness to understand and probe into technical details.

Collaborate with cross-functional areas to understand and articulate data flow across systems including key integration points and surfacing of data to the care team.

Join forces with functional managers and other business areas to ensure all workflow processes and interdependencies are identified and addressed.

Lead business program management responsibilities including but not limited to building comprehensive delivery plan, tracking progress, and providing regular status updates.

Optimize team performance by understanding dependencies, risks, and ability to resolve barriers to success.

Obtain financial support for projects and monitor budget, raising awareness if over/under spending.

Excellent verbal and written communications skills


10+ years or more of managed care / health insurance experience

Minimum 5 years of experience in Project Management and/or managing projects end to end

Minimum 5 years of experience in Technology

Multiple years proven leadership experience setting strategic direction and influencing change that resulted in quantifiable positive outcomes.

Strong organization skills and excellent verbal/written communications skills

At least 1 year of experience utilizing Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) methodology

Basic understanding of Health Information Technologies

Good understanding of CVS Health and its various business units

Understanding of Health Information Exchanges (HIE’s) and Electronic Health Record (EHRs)

Some experience in provider or network management

Strong analytics/data visualization skills

Demonstrated ability to navigate through ambiguity and provide a structured problem-solving approach

Strong attention to detail and a focus on mobilizing the organization to deliver the strategy.


BS/BA or equivalent experience and 8-10 years of experience related to technology, systems, bidirectional exchange of data, project or data vendor management.

Job_Description:
McKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by the CDC, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.
McKesson’s Pharmaceutical Solutions and Services (PSaS) Decision Intelligence (DI) team is looking for a Senior Business Data Analyst to support strategic data initiatives. Title: Sr Business Data Analyst
Job_Description:
McKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by the CDC, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.
Senior Information Security Analysts are expected to assist with strategic initiatives for short- as well as long-term plans to identify and reduce the attack surface across applications and systems. Use of automated tools to identify, assess and report is expected, with emphasis placed on effective communication to constituents relying on applications and systems that support their business. Sr. Information Security Analysts take an active lead to inform, advise and partner with business units to help better secure their operations.
Senior Information Security Analyst is an advanced, hands-on practitioner and representative of the Vulnerability Management team. The role is technical, and candidates must possess a solid understanding of information security and preferably have held positions in cybersecurity and systems administration. The role is responsible for the overall management lifecycle of the Vulnerability Management program. They must understand applications, operating systems, networking, cloud infrastructure and basic attacker tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs). Additionally, analysts are expected to maintain a high level of rigor to stay up-to-date with advancements in technology, while also retaining knowledge of older systems and applications in use.

Title: Sr Business Data Analyst
Job_Description:
The Product Owner (PO) is a member of the Agile Product Team responsible for defining stories and prioritizing the Team backlog. This is an instrumental role in driving day to day development for the Pharmacy program that touches millions of consumers. Specifically this role will support both Caremark.com and CVS.com; working on Claims Submission and Pharmacy features (Drug Information, Health resources). This person will be responsible for streamlining the execution of team priorities while maintaining the conceptual and technical integrity of the features/ components for the team along with driving clear outcomes. The PO has a significant role in quality control and is the only team member empowered to accept stories as done. This role has significant relationships and responsibilities outside the local team, including working with Product Manager, who is responsible for the Program Backlog, to prepare for the Program Increment (PI) Planning meeting.

1. User Story Development

2. Team Backlog Ownership/Prioritization
o Security
o Performance monitoring
o Run cost/maintenance plan

3. Program Increment Planning
program stakeholders.
o Manage and prioritize product backlog
o Work in close partnership with client teams, UX designers and engineers to implement the vision
o Engage closely with cross-functional teams including marketing and engineering to bring products to market in a timely manner
o Develop business cases/1 pager overviews around new features and capabilities for product themes and epics
o Serve as a representative for your products with marketing and sales
o Follow agile methodology to establish proper documentation and acceptance criteria with POs to achieve a “productized” set up APIs
o Analyze data on a continuous and daily basis to assess the success of your product.

4. Maintain Conceptual and Technical Integrity of Features/Components

-Analytical orientation - metrics driven product development

Title: Sr Business Data Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Description

The HR Service Delivery Analyst will support the LATAM (Latin America) region in providing Tier 2 escalation support for HRSC (Human Resource Service Center) / Data Transactions and Tier 3 support for LATAM related escalations (i.e. language specific needs, country nuances). The HR Service Delivery Analyst will manage Service Delivery mailbox for client escalations, trouble shoot system issues with suppliers (i.e., Workday, ADP), manage and reconcile error log transactions for Payroll ADP.

The position will also require data analysis, trends, volume discussions with key stakeholders across HR Ops and external suppliers (i.e.: GTA (Global Talent Administration) support, HR Support Center) management of Tier 2 data transactions, downstream notifications and inbox tasks performed by the supplier. HR Support Center & Data Transactions Training and Knowledge Updates (i.e. Work Instructions, SOPs) - HR Library ownership (i.e.: work with IT). Ownership of downstream notifications for SharePoint and Region matrix for letters (i.e., hire, movement) and Manage supplier relationships (i.e. Accenture).

Candidates should have a working understanding of all areas noted but also have the ability to leverage internal and external resources to fulfill requests accurately and efficiently.


Respond to highly complex inquiries via email or phone during normal business hours.

Track inquiries/cases by utilizing HR case management and knowledge management system

Partner proactively with Call Center Analysts to provide guidance and coaching. Identify when additional training or knowledge is needed to prevent escalations.

Research and analyze data and information, navigate multiple systems, resources and tools to investigate and provide accurate answers.

Partner effectively with local HR Teams to resolve complicated issues.

Ability to apply reason and process when working through complex inquiries.

Follow standard procedures and practices, Service Level Agreements, Standard Operating Procedures, and meet or exceed operational goals.

Participate on special assignments or teams as assigned.

Recommend changes or updates to call center software solutions and HR Portal content to enable better employee and manager self-service support.


At least four years of related work experience, e.g. Human Resources, call center, or customer care.

Proven track record in providing high touch, complex customer support to all areas of business.

Advanced specialized knowledge in all areas of concentration (e.g. Payroll, Restructuring, Supplier Management, HR Tools (Workday)

Excellent applied judgment and professionalism.

Exceptional oral and written communication skills.

Effective team player with collaborative focus.

High degree of integrity and personal ethics in implementing corporate policies and procedures.

Ability to work independently and coordinate with key partner groups.

Portuguese / Spanish required


Bachelor's Degree

ServiceNow experience.

Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with ongoing technology and process changes.

Ability to demonstrate flexibility and adjusting to new ways of working.

Our Support Functions deliver services and make recommendations about ways to enhance our workplace and the culture of our organization. Our Support Functions include HR, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Procurement, Administration, Facilities and Security.

Who we are …

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for …

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. Title: Sr Business Data Analyst
Job_Description:
Represent CVS Health information security practices via client facing Information Security Client Assurance function. This role will provide extraordinary support to our clients and will navigate complex client security assurance relation issues. You will do this by partnering with business account teams, legal & privacy to support Request For Information/Proposal (RFI/P) responses, client third party risk management assessments, contractual compliance reviews, complex security schedule negotiation, and end-to-end deal support process management. Delight our clients by providing Request For Information/Proposal (RFI/P) responses, responding to client third party risk management questionnaires and updating our client facing security materials based on the latest industry trends. Leverage & maintain a current knowledge base for all information security policies, standards, procedures and practices to accurately represent CVS Health’s information security posture.

Responsibilities shall include:
1. Ensure requests for standard information security assurance materials are sent to requestors in a secure, timely and professional manner

3. Support Strategic client continuous monitoring activities through hosting regular client touch bases, facilitation of application security artifacts and client specific contractual deliverables
4. Provide Extradorarny support to our clients, be the voice of the client from an information security perspective while interfacing with other internal partners. Negotiate complex security schedules alongside legal to protect CVS Health business while focusing upon winning business
5. Facilitate, host and manage external client assessments of CVS Health Security practices

Title: Sr Business Data Analyst
Job_Description:
This role will work closely with the CVS.com, Marketing, Specialty and Rx Operations, Caremark.com, Specialty business and technical teams to deliver functionality for the CVS.com, Caremark.com, specialty.com site. Act as architect for medium to large projects and drive the design do solutions for the CVS.com, caremark.com, specialty business that are cloud native, scalable, maintainable and reliable. Proactively identify and evaluate emerging technologies and tools. Work with other senior architects to create the high-level software designs and technical specifications. Manage the evolution of architectural roadmaps for your domain, showing how new features are released or updated, with an eye on paying down technical debt with minimal disruption.

Evaluate package solutions and participate in selection of solutions to meet business needs and architecture standards. Provide guidance to developers and other stakeholders on architectural best practices, guidelines, and standards. Evangelize, mentor, and coach all on the same.

Participate in peer reviews on specifications, design and code. Work with development teams to resolve development and implementation issues. Work closely with the CVS Online business team and Business Analysts to ensure that requirements are fully understood and documented in order to deliver quality design deliverables. Lead Proof-Of-Concepts and Spike Solutions, and provide “Reference Architectures” and “Baseline Implementations” when appropriate. Work closely with QA and Operations to ensure smooth QA and deployment of applications. Work with project teams to plan integration and implementation strategies. Communicate very technical material to a non-technical business audience. Provide guidance, direction and mentorship to Architects.

Provide guidance to developers and other stakeholders regarding the design of server applications and UI clients, encompassing APIs and frameworks, micro-services, containers, databases, cloud infrastructures, and cloud services, etc.

Responsible for implementation of large systems that utilize MicroServices , cloud technologies. Apply knowledge of designing n-tier OO system architecture using EJB technologies, MicroServices and cloud technologies. Create architecture and design patterns in Java, cloud & Microservices. Select, design and implement Microservices, Content management and Cloud Native systems.

Ensure all Non-Functional Requirements (e.g. performance, availability and fail-over, scalability, security, etc.) are properly articulated, and work with all parties to guarantee that the software products that are delivered meet these objectives. Drive buy vs build evaluations, including consideration of OSS.

Participates in high-level estimation Work closely with other architects to create and implement new system designs as well as make improvements to existing systems. Serve as subject matter expert working with business stakeholders, architecting use cases relevant to Digital Pharmacy across multiple enterprise systems. Collaborate with technical experts to develop solution during the design phase, enabling the implementation of final solutions. Ensuring the technical integrity, consistency and adherence to architectural standards. Implementation of architectural artifacts depicting the solution consisting of all necessary integrations and technical components.

Minimum: 95,000
Maximum: 209,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.
