Title: Lead Data Engineer - Application Development
Job_Description:
We are looking for a team-oriented technology professional to provide support of F5 technologies across a large enterprise. This individual will work with developers and security as needed to design, support and implement F5 based solutions to support the enterprise.

As a Senior Networking Engineer, you will need to have an in-depth working knowledge of iRules, TCP, LTM, GTM, Web Application Firewall and Bot Net Defense in large enterprise environments.

Off hours work is required for deployments and on-call rotation. This role reports in to Senior Director, Systems Engineering.

Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 95,000
Maximum: 209,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


5+ years of experience in IT
3+ years of experience & knowledge of:
F5 Local Traffic Manager
F5 Global Traffic Manager
F5 iRule Creation and Management
F5 Health Checks
F5 AS3 Configuration
TCP Dump and Analysis
Experience in deploying and supporting F5 in cloud environments.


Automation Experience
AWAF Management and Implementation
Experience in deploying and supporting F5 in cloud environments.


Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience

Title: Lead Data Engineer - Application Development
Job_Description:
*Potential for fully remote*
Main locations - AZ, RI, CT

The Carrier Transmission Services – Senior Analyst position is responsible for implementing and maintaining the Wide Area Networking infrastructure supporting 500+ locations in a high-paced, complex environment. In addition to the WAN responsibilities, the position is also partly responsible for the enterprise SIP/VoIP connectivity to CVS’s external constituents (Carrier voice trunking, DIDs, TFNs, and Dialplan management).

Duties include (but not limited to):
Ordering and coordinating circuit installs with telecom carriers and network/voice teams (Data, Voice, etc.)
Ordering and provisioning DID and Toll-Free numbers

The Sr Analyst will work cross-organizationally to set-up and/or resolve issues with the network infrastructure team, firewall team, internet team, and the voice team. Designing system layouts/configurations and planning new product implementations including pricing for new projects to meet business needs are also included in the responsibilities. The position is typically M-F, but the position is part of an on-call rotation which includes nights and weekends.


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 60,000
Maximum: 128,700

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


- 3+ years expertise with Signaling Protocols - ISDN, CAS, Analog, T1/E1 PRI, E&M.





Bachelor’s degree preferred

H.S Diploma with extensive experience required

Coding experience with IIS, C#, .Net and Unix Shell scripting
Experience using automation with Ansible automation (for middleware platforms)
Experience using JCL (Job Control Language) to run batch jobs

Title: Lead Data Engineer - Application Development
Job_Description:
The Wellpartner Network Engineer is responsible for supporting the day-to-day operation of the production datacenter, standby datacenter, and cloud connectivity while supporting the ongoing design, deployment, and management of all network assets including firewalls, perimeter and core routing & switching infrastructure, DCI/Interconnects, VPN concentrators, and other network elements. Position reports into Wellpartner infrastructure operations management.
Provide ongoing VPN tunnel engineering and implementation support with a focus on onboarding new covered entities, addressing VPN peer and tunnel migrations, whitelisting, and managing related IPSec policy, configuration, and ongoing process development

Supporting LAN/WAN technologies, including VLANs, STP, ACL, IPSec VPN tunnels, VRF, VRRP-E/HSRP, and BGP/OSPF protocols with a focus on Cisco, Brocade, Arista, or similar vendors

Title: Lead Data Engineer - Application Development
Job_Description:
CVS Health Digital is looking for hands-on, passionate people who want to join a high energy and growing team to make a difference in customers’ lives and who want to be on the forefront of digital innovation that aims to reinvent what a pharmacy and a health care company can be in the digital world.

We are seeking a Principal Salesforce Engineer who will be responsible for creating and delivering, in a timely and accurate fashion, CRMs and workflow solutions using Salesforce, Apex, Lightning, Visualforce and J2EE technologies. This Principal Salesforce Engineer will additionally be responsible for the application design, development and support of Salesforce related projects. This Engineer must demonstrate progressive leadership in the full life cycle of the software development environment.

The Principal Salesforce Engineer will be responsible for the detailed design of Salesforce related projects from inception through production support. This will be completed through the use of UML diagrams, design documentation and best-practice methodologies. The Engineer will be responsible for ensuring that the system accurately meets the defined expectations of the business unit, ensuring that proper testing is implemented and performance requirements are closely monitored by working with the development teams.


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 95,000
Maximum: 209,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.






Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent years of experience

Title: Lead Data Engineer - Application Development
Job_Description:
CVS Health Digital is looking for hands-on, passionate people who want to join a high energy and growing team to make a difference in customers’ lives and who want to be on the forefront of digital innovation that aims to reinvent what a pharmacy and a health care company can be in the digital world.

We are seeking a Principal Salesforce Engineer who will be responsible for creating and delivering, in a timely and accurate fashion, CRMs and workflow solutions using Salesforce, Apex, Lightning, Visualforce and J2EE technologies. This Principal Salesforce Engineer will additionally be responsible for the application design, development and support of Salesforce related projects. This Engineer must demonstrate progressive leadership in the full life cycle of the software development environment.

The Principal Salesforce Engineer will be responsible for the detailed design of Salesforce related projects from inception through production support. This will be completed through the use of UML diagrams, design documentation and best-practice methodologies. The Engineer will be responsible for ensuring that the system accurately meets the defined expectations of the business unit, ensuring that proper testing is implemented and performance requirements are closely monitored by working with the development teams.


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 95,000
Maximum: 209,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.






Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent years of experience

Job_Description:
CVS Health Digital is looking for hands-on, passionate people who want to join a high energy and growing team to make a difference in customers’ lives and who want to be on the forefront of digital innovation that aims to reinvent what a pharmacy and a health care company can be in the digital world. Work with Product and UX teams to be part of a team of engineers in developing elegant code, state-of-the-art customer experiences and build industry leading digital experiences


The typical pay range for this role is:

5+ years of experience in salesforce configuration and customization
4+ years of experience with Salesforce Lightning, Apex, Visualforce, triggers, flows and process builders.
4+ years of experience in salesforce security model and data model
4+ years of experience in integrating Salesforce with other cloud and on-prem systems leveraging REST, SOAP, Bulk APIs in both real-time and batch mode.
4+ years of experience in Force.com IDE, VSC, CLI, GIT, Data Migration tools, SOQL/SOSL and Salesforce Reports / Dashboards.


Excellent debugging skills; able to debug complex technical issues involving multiple system components.
Excellent Collaboration skills to work within and outside the team.
Superior analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Experience and expertise in core web technologies including HTML5, Javascript and jQuery
Experience in working on shared platform environment
Familiarity with CheckMarx, PMD, AutoRABIT (or similar CI/CD tool)
Knowledge in story grooming, design, configuration, testing and deployment of Salesforce.com solutions leveraging SAFe/Agile framework
Should be familiar with Salesforce Service Cloud features and capabilities
Should be familiar with integration Salesforce with CTI/IVR systems
Should be familiar with enabling SSO capabilities for Salesforce with Azure AD/Siteminder.
Experience in developing accessible applications with stringent audit requirements
Software engineering skills with Force.com Platform (Apex, VisualForce, SOQL, Unit Testing)
Software engineering skills with Java SE & EE (Java, JSF, SQL) preferred
Demonstrated experience and knowledge of relational databases, data modeling, and ETL tools
Ability to partner with various areas such as architecture, product owners and QA engineers in order to deliver top of the line business solutions
Working knowledge and experience with complex business systems integration as well as object-oriented design patterns and development
Familiarity with Services Oriented Design Principles (SOA) and Web Service
Excellent organizational and time management skills
PD1 and PD2 certification

Title: Embedded Flight Controls Software Engineer
Job_Description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.
Description:Come and experience your future!

Be the best possible you!

At Lockheed Martin, we are passionate about innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our capacity – and yours as a Lockheed Martin employee. Lockheed Martin values your skills, training, education, and background.

Do you want to be part of an environment that encourages and supports employees to think big, perform with quality and build incredible products? We provide the resources, reassurance, and focus - if you have the resourcefulness and courage to work hard, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.

Define the future of aviation. Stand at the forefront of technology and innovation. Transform your ideas and dreams into reality. Join Lockheed Martin’s Flight Controls and Autonomy team and be part of the greatest transformation in aviation history; unmanned fully autonomous flight.

The Flight Controls and Autonomy team is currently seeking highly motivated technology pioneers with a desire to steer and lead the Autonomy industry. Successful candidates must be willing and able to work on highly complex complicated problems.

Leading to world-changing technological breakthroughs.

Team’s technical areas of emphasis include Fly-By-Wire Flight Control Systems, Guidance/Navigation & Control (GNC), Flight Test, Autonomy, Aviation Robotics, Perception, AI, and Motion Planning.

This position is within the Flight Controls and Autonomy Software group located in Stratford, CT. This position requires a software engineer to work as part of a modeling and software development team. The team uses a wide application of modern technical principles, theories, and concepts in the software field to develop, integrate, and test conventional and fly-by-wire flight control system software products for Sikorsky’s helicopter platforms.

The candidate will be responsible for the planning, development, integration, and verification of flight control software. The candidate will be responsible for the software efforts as part of an Integrated Product Team (IPT) in the development and maintenance of flight control system software for a variety of platforms. Candidate responsibilities will span the software development lifecycle, including planning, requirements management, detail design and implementation, integration and test, flight test, and adjudicating change requests as the software is updated, tested, and integrated. Integration activities may include a multitude of host systems, such as live aircraft, simulated systems, and laboratory environments that include constructive simulations, physical hardware, and system simulations.

The successful candidate will work with a multi-program and multi-disciplinary team and must be self-motivated with a strong work ethic, time-management, and interpersonal skills. The successful candidate must have demonstrated effective communication skills as the position will require frequent inter-organizational and potential outside customer interactions.

C/C++ programming experience is required. Cross compiler toolchain development experience is required. Working knowledge of different Avionics data buses (ARINC-429, MIL-STD-1553, IEEE 1394, Ethernet and Time-Triggered Ethernet) is required. Experience with DO-178B/C, DO-330, and DO-331 is required. The ability to work at all levels of the software lifecycle is required. Experience with MATLAB, Simulink, Stateflow and Embedded Coder is required. Development and use of Python and PERL scripting tools is required.

In addition to the responsibilities highlighted above we offer extensive benefits that include competitive 401k and insurance. We remain an equal opportunity company.


Desired skills :

job.Qualifications


Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.

Experienced Professional

Title: Embedded Flight Controls Software Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description
Associate Director, Lead Backend Engineer will work within the Human Health Insights, Analytics and Data area to contribute to development of our advanced data science application platform. We are realizing the vision of a cohesive commercial decision support suite, helping stakeholders make data-driven decisions to optimize delivery of our product to patients. Title: Digital Hardware/Firmware Engineer II
Job_Description:
CVS Pharmacy, Inc., a CVS Health company, is hiring for the following role in Richardson, TX: Manager, Architecture to design and develop innovative cloud solutions to complex applications, system administration, or network issues. Duties include: verify performance, availability, and scalability for the Public Cloud environment and system architecture; leverage new and existing technology to accelerate the transformation of IT in support of the business and identify software components to meet user needs; collaborate with Architects and Engineers to ensure enterprise application solution designs meet or exceed the organization’s business goals; support applications, system architectures, and databases used to process prescriptions, claims, and related healthcare activities; work with cross-functional teams on daily tasks to support project planning and implementation; and identify emerging technologies for cloud native workload to enable and accelerate the journey to the Cloud. Telecommuting available.

Required Qualifications
Requires a Master’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field and two (2) years of experience in each of the following: Performing system tuning and workload management, including Teradata Active System Management (TASM) administration and system resource allocation; Performing SQL Query Tuning, including ad hoc end-user/application query tuning for database environments (e.g., DEV, QAT, UAT, and PRD); Unix Shell Scripting; Teradata utilities such as FastLoad, MultiLoad, and TPT; and Performing database backup/recovery operations using Teradata’s native backup utilities.
Alternate requirements: Bachelor’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field and five (5) years of progressive, post-baccalaureate experience in each of the following: Performing system tuning and workload management, including Teradata Active System Management (TASM) administration and system resource allocation; Performing SQL Query Tuning, including ad hoc end-user/application query tuning for database environments (e.g., DEV, QAT, UAT, and PRD); Unix Shell Scripting; Teradata utilities such as FastLoad, MultiLoad, and TPT; and Performing database backup/recovery operations using Teradata’s native backup utilities.

Title: Digital Hardware/Firmware Engineer II
Job_Description:
Job Description

New hires in office-based roles in the US & Puerto Rico will be required, subject to applicable law, to demonstrate that they have been fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or qualify for a medical or religious exemption to this vaccination requirement that can be accommodated without an undue burden to the operation. However, subject to applicable law, employees working in roles that the Company determines require routine collaboration with external stakeholders, such as employees in health services, customer facing commercial, or research based roles, will be required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment.

“$2,500 Sign-On Bonus available for New External Hires. The sign-on bonus will be paid within your first regularly scheduled paycheck.”

Our Engineers support internal and external manufacturing operations remain operational, continuously improve and innovate. With our extensive range of facilities and environments, our Engineers have opportunities across many diverse areas including Biological, Chemical, Automation, Capital Projects, Maintenance, Safety, Process Development, Technical Services, Utilities and Validation.

The Reliability Engineer will fill a key role at the Elkhorn facility in development and implementation of an Equipment Reliability and Computerized Maintenance Management System. As the subject matter expert in CMMS system administration, the Reliability Engineer will lead the Preventive Maintenance program, Improve Equipment uptime and equipment Meant Time Between Failure Analysts. This individual will be able to perform Work Order Management, Performance Trending, Calibration, and Spare Parts Inventory Management. The position will be responsible for collecting performance actor data, developing predictive techniques, and implementing preventative maintenance programs for the Elkhorn Maintenance Team.

Additionally, the Reliability Engineer will manage the contracted parts crib team. Parts crib management will include development of kitting plans for critical equipment and will ensure fulfillment by through the parts crib. In support of driving quality and safety cultures, the Reliability Engineer will serve as a lead point of contact for Corrective Action Preventative Action (CAPA) tracking and execution for the Engineering and Maintenance Department.

This position will have broad above site involvement as the local representative in our Company Global Reliability platform collaboration, and information sharing team. As a resident expert, the Reliability Engineer will develop and deliver successful training on operating/maintenance best practices for maintenance and operations personnel. The Reliability Engineer will also learn and maintain critical safety related equipment programs including Pressure Safety Device inventory/management, Lockout Tagout, and critical device management.


Develop Critical Equipment list, and a Bad Actor list for the site.

Assess, measure, track, and report on key reliability indicators for critical equipment systems.

Develop Preventive Maintenance procedures for Critical Equipment.

Develop and implement Kitting Programs for Critical Equipment.

Develop and implement a Predictive Maintenance Program for Critical Equipment.

Participate in equipment failure and contamination investigations.

Responsible as the CAPA point of contact for the Engineering and Maintenance department.

Develop and provide training to Maintenance associates regarding preventive and predictive maintenance.

Collaborate with the corporate Reliability team to maximize site reliability performance.

Responsible as the Change Control point of contact for Utility and Critical Equipment.

Develop Lock Out Tag Out procedures for new equipment.

Review existing Lock Out Tag Out procedures for compliance with the site standards.



High School diploma

Associates degree with a minimum of 4 years experience in a manufacturing environment

Bachelor's degree with a minimum of 2 years experience in a manufacturing environment


Possess strong problem-solving skills and able to examine an issue from diverse perspectives (safety, compliance, automation, equipment, process, and people) in order to best understand and resolve it at root cause

Ability to read and interpret technical/engineering documents, drawings, schematics

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Expertise and proficiency with basic office computer software, and the ability to learn how to effectively use SAP maintenance software to input data, research parts and analyze repair history detail.

Must be able to be exposed to extreme temperatures, outside weather in all conditions, high noise environments, work areas near moving mechanical parts and any chemicals used in production process.

Minimum 3 years experience in USDA or similarly regulated manufacturing environment

Communication, leadership, and teamwork skills.

Lean and six sigma skills

Our Manufacturing & Supply Division is dedicated to being the most trusted supplier of biopharmaceuticals worldwide. Our facilities, along with our external contractors, suppliers, and partners, create a reliable global manufacturing network that’s devoted to delivering a high-quality, reliable supply to customers and patients on time, every time.

Who we are …

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for …

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

Overview of Position
Change Healthcare (CHC) is looking for a Senior Software Engineer in the payments organization for our new React and Node based NextGen Payments as well as our legacy .NET platforms. Change Healthcare engineering team is architecting a cloud-based payments platform in emerging technologies. As a senior engineer, you will contribute in a multitude of way - own large sections of our codebase, drive strategic technical improvements, create sweeping improvements in stability, performance and scalability across business-critical systems. As an experienced senior engineer, you will consistently be able to reduce product complexity, eliminate single point of failures, simplify codebase and processes to get more done with less work. This role would require you to work at a cross-engineering scope and mentor the engineering team to develop, build, and scale the payments platform at large volumes. As a broader team impact, you will anticipate technical issues, come up with larger ideas particularly on reliability and scalability, and advocate them convincingly.

Title: Compliance Monitoring and Data Analytics Specialist
Job_Description:
MAJOR DUTIES:
1. Reviews, analyzes and summarizes information in support of Department of Energy (DOE) Access Authorization and Reinvestigation Programs. Recommends appropriate adjudicative action based on experience, training and judgment according to 10 CFR 710.8 Criteria Codes and DOE Order 472.2A. Communication to DOE Federal employees and DOE Federal Subcontractors applies to all areas indicated below to include: Savannah River Site, Waste Isolation Pilot Plant (WIPP – Carlsbad), Emergency Management Consolidated Business Center (EMCBC) and National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA).
2. Interfaces with DOE HR (Human Resources), Requesting Officials, DOE employees and DOE subcontractors. Initiates employees’ information into the Electronic Questionnaires for Investigations Processing (e-QIP) database, re-initiates, re-sets passwords, provides assistance, and resolves computer related issues. Ensures Homeland Security Presidential Directive 12 (HSPD-12) registration has been completed. Tracks and communicates clearance requirements for Initials and Reinvestigations. Reviews justification for clearance, drug testing results and e-QIP forms, while maintaining timelines during onboarding employees. Determines adequacy, credibility and completeness of information received. Summarizes findings and makes appropriate recommendation to DOE for next course of action. Identifies derogatory information/mitigating circumstances and makes an adjudicative recommendation to DOE to process, reapprove, defer, or request additional information. Updates shared spreadsheets daily to ensure timely processing. Prepares budget sheet with investigation codes for submission to the Defense Counterintelligence Servicing Agency (DCSA). Writes new desk top procedures and completes revisions to existing procedures.

Title: Compliance Monitoring and Data Analytics Specialist

Job Description

Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.

Senior Specialist, Core Applications Engineer will be part of a high-performing global team responsible for managing and engineering the end-user environment. The role provides consolidated guidance on strategic direction, processes, and architectural and engineering decisions that interface the Client Engineering Windows environments. The role is both hands-on engineering and solutions architecture; with relationship and process management across several functional areas, all that in a highly regulated complex pharma environment.

The role requires leveraging industry-leading tools and processes to provide high-quality, reliable, and cost-effective desktop management services to global Company employees. It requires a technically strong person who is resourceful, highly self-motivated, attentive to detail, and able to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.


Engineer corporate end-user desktop and applications environment. Represent Client computing (CC) group and work with several departments across IT. Be responsible for engineering and managing core application solutions globally.

Responsibility for successful integration to the Windows image: selected client packages lifecycle (working with app owners), client policy updates in security tools and windows area, performance, impact, problem analysis working with multiple stakeholders

Provide technical standards; selected applications, client OS, browser security compliance, and hardening

Test and deploy group policy, baselines, and various configurations in both physical DEV and PROD environments

Develop, engineer, manage and maintain risk assessment technical and process standards in the area of application analysis, vulnerability assessment, approved applications

3rd & 4th level support and identification of root cause with strategic solutions (requests/CPRs/outages)

Working with the latest technologies

Research and master new technologies quickly

Provide technical guidance and implementation

Work closely with other teams and stakeholders on various projects such as App Services, Deployment Services, and Applications Owners, the Core Applications group, and Information Security teams

Work closely with Active Directory team to engineer and maintain the structural hierarchy

Ensure adherence to global standards, policies, and Service Level Agreements (SLA)

Collaborate across IT and business areas to develop and implement new processes that help maintain our corporate computing environment

We are seeking professionals with the following qualifications, skills, and experience:


Master’s degree or relevant experience in Computer Science, Computer Science Engineering, Math, or High School Diploma with 8 overall years of experience.


6+ years practical experience engineering and supporting Windows OS environment

8+ years practical experience managing Microsoft and Adobe technologies in large enterprises: Windows 7+, Windows Server 2008+, Active Directory Services, Group Policy, Configuration Manager 2012+, Windows Security, and general IT infrastructure overview

6+ years practical experience with managing core applications (Office, Adobe, Middleware) on the desktop so they are engineered with security compliance, governance adherence, and standards in large enterprises

6+ years practical experience with managing browser security and architecting browser strategy in large environments – Chrome, IE, EDGE, Firefox

Strong understanding and knowledge of managing Beyond Trust Defender Policies

Strong understanding and knowledge of other Beyond Trust products

Strong technical knowledge and in-depth understanding of Group policy configurations and Windows 7+ in a regulated environment

Microsoft WMI, PowerShell, VBScript

Good understanding of overall large enterprise computer management (Software Distribution, Active Directory, Applications packaging, Apps provisioning, Apps applications lifecycle and compliance)

Good understanding of current enterprise IT trends such as remote team management, WaaS, Office 365, Cloud computing

Extensive technical troubleshooting capabilities

Ability to document and maintain Standard Operation Procedures, Work Instructions, and System Development Lifecycle Management

Fluency in reading/writing/speaking English

Ability to effectively communicate with various project stakeholders including, IT leadership, business customers, team members, and other IT colleagues.

Strong collaboration, presentation, and influencing skills

Strong intellectual curiosity and capacity for professional growth.


Ability to take initiative and work with minimum direction in a highly demanding environment

Strong technical and analytical skills with an ability to adapt and rapidly learn new technologies

Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA) certification or similar

Ability to present technical ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language

Real-world project management or project coordination experience is a plus

Good working knowledge of ITIL framework or TOGAF framework (certification is a plus)

Work experience in the biopharma industry and/or other regulated environments

Title: Compliance Monitoring and Data Analytics Specialist
Job_Description:
Change Healthcare is a leading healthcare technology company with a mission to inspire a better healthcare system. We deliver innovative solutions to patients, hospitals, and insurance companies to improve clinical decision making, simplify financial processes, and enable better patient experiences to improve lives and support healthier communities.
Overview of Position
After a client (Payer, TPA or insurance company) has signed a contract with Change Healthcare, this individual will guide the client through a 1-6 month implementation schedule to begin processing the client’s live data through our system. Larger revenue projects will include the assignment of a certified project manager. Smaller projects will require the implementation specialist to perform multiple responsibilities focused around three key skills, project management, client communications and business analysis.

Title: Compliance Monitoring and Data Analytics Specialist
Job_Description:
Job Description

Our Finance team brings together our financial perspectives into our overall strategic and tactical decision making. We use state-of-the-art techniques for financial analysis, planning, accounting, reporting and performance evaluation. This allows the organization to continue advancing medical innovation and improve lives.

Our Development team ensure production can be scaled up whilst remaining stable, effective, deliverable and safe. Following formulation, cutting edge computer modelling techniques are used to simulate outcomes and, if successful, PKPD and toxicity studies bring the science one step closer to giving hope to patients.

Position Description:
Under the guidance of the Clinical Development Finance Associate Director, the Finance Senior Specialist will:

Provide financial planning, forecasting and analytical support for assigned Clinical Development Teams.

Forecast grant spend related to Vaccines clinical studies and potentially other Therapeutic Areas, as well as providing financial support for associated collaborations with external partners in these clinical areas.

Be the primary point of Finance contact with stakeholders including the Global Project Manager, Global Trial Manager, Clinical Sub Team, Clinical Trial Team and Outsourced Trial Team for all project issues related to study budget, site and vendor related payments, asset valuation and impairment.

Develop and participate in team presentations to the Financial & Operational Review Committee, Late Development Review Committee and Discovery and Translational Research Committee.

Support project team decision making by providing relevant financial information and insight.

Play a central role in developing the Profit Plan, Long Range Operating Plan, Quarterly Forecasts, and Monthly Refreshes at the clinical study level.

Review of all US site payments related to visits completed, milestones completed and reimbursement for out of pocket expenses according to Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, the Sarbanes Oxley Act as well as internal and external accounting guidance.


Gain end-to-end exposure of our Company's drug development process and the Research & Development pipeline while gaining relevant experience supporting clinical out of pocket spend for the Global Clinical Development department.

Influence and impact by helping clients navigate a world of almost limitless scientific opportunities with limited financial resources. A background in Science is helpful but not necessary.

Further develop your creative thinking and problem-solving skills as many problems don’t have hard anchor points or routine analytical approaches.

Increase your network through engagement with other business partners (Project Mgmt., Procurement, GCTO, etc.)



Bachelors Degree in Business, Finance/Accounting, Science or Engineering.


Minimum of 2 years of operations or Finance experience


MBA or other Masters/PhD in Business, Finance, Science or Engineering

Excellent analytical skills and the ability to develop business operations models

Strong financial acumen

Proactive approach to problem solving

Results and process-driven orientation

Demonstrated ability to effectively work in a challenging and complex environment

Demonstrated ability to influence, build and maintain diverse client and peer relationships

Sound and balanced judgment, with the ability to assess and handle risk

Excellent communications skills

Strong computer skills especially working with SAP, BPC and MS Excel

We are a research-driven biopharmaceutical company. Our mission is built on the simple premise that if we “follow the science” that great medicines can make a significant impact to our world. We believe that a research-driven enterprise dedicated to world-class science can succeed by inventing medicine and vaccine innovations that make a difference for patients across the globe.

Our Support Functions deliver services and make recommendations about ways to enhance our workplace and the culture of our organization. Our Support Functions include HR, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Procurement, Administration, Facilities and Security.

Who we are …

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for …

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

Title: Compliance Monitoring and Data Analytics Specialist
Job_Description:
How would you like to be a part of AmSty’s mission of enhancing lives through materials and know-how in a responsible and sustainable manner?

At AmSty, our team of dynamic associates are continuously leading AmSty to be the top integrated producer of polystyrene and styrene monomer. Our size and geographic footprint allow us to provide solutions to our broad range of customers.

At AmSty, our success is based on world-scale production technology and supply chain capability. All of our dedicated associates possess a strong continuing focus on safety, reliability and environmental compliance.

Open the door to your future at AmSty!

Overview: Under the direction of the Director of Technology and Polystyrene Operations, the Process Engineer Specialist will work with Plant Engineers to define and implement the most effective chemical process technology, providing technical solutions and process engineering expertise on capital projects, technology implementation projects, productivity, quality, and cost improvement projects, etc. to all AmSty manufacturing facilities. The role is responsible for the effective application of process technology to achieve safe, reliable, and cost-effective operation. This individual promotes a strong continuous improvement spirit to assist facilities in achieving top quartile results. This role will be located at the St James, LA facility.

Title: Compliance Monitoring and Data Analytics Specialist

At AmSty, our success is based on world-scale production technology and supply chain capability. All of our dedicated associates possess a strong continuing focus on safety, reliability and environmental compliance.

Open the door to your future at AmSty!

The successful candidate in this position will drive application development and business growth in polystyrene. This role will work closely with the technology organization for product development and interface with commercial to define customer-driven opportunities. The role requires high initiative, problem solving, proactive application of scientific principles & experimental design, good project management skills and the ability to work successfully in varying environments and responsibilities. Excellent communication skills and the ability to cooperate closely with customers and across internal functions are essential. A passion for technology and the high affinity to understanding customer needs and application requirements are important.

Title: Compliance Monitoring and Data Analytics Specialist
Job_Description:
Job Description

New hires based in the US & Puerto Rico will be required to demonstrate that they have been fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or qualify for a medical or religious exemption or accommodation to this vaccination requirement, subject to applicable law.

Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.

The Digital Marketing Solutions team part of the Global AH IT team is looking for a Sr. Specialist Mobile App Analyst to join the Digital Marketing Solutions team. Responsibilities include managing the release of Animal Health’s internal and external iPhone and Android applications; providing consultation to our suppliers to troubleshoot and resolve development and publication issues; reporting and analytics for internal and external mobile apps; liaison with Apple and Google’s review teams; working with other teams in the company to establish quality guidelines; ensuring that mobile apps meet company’s compliance and technical requirements. The position will require mobile development experience and the ability to understand, build, and troubleshoot code from our suppliers, but the mobile app technical lead will not be developing mobile applications themselves. As the position involves providing guidance to other teams and active collaboration with both technical and non-technical personnel, solid technical and non-technical communication skills will be required to succeed.


Review all new mobile app project demand. This is to ensure project fits within our technology stack. The mobile app technical lead involves collaborating with regional IT, agencies, business owners, and other DMS team members. Be an influencer in designing the right technical approach both from an industry standard and from company/DMS guidelines for app development.

internally to our internal Apps store, and externally to the App Store and Google Play Store.

Management and organization of app source code using our BitBucket GIT repository.

Management of users for agencies to ensure appropriate repository access rights.

Submission of compiled code to our vulnerability scanning tool(s), and providing remediation advice to development teams (with assistance from the ITRMS AppSec team).

Compiling apps for testing on approved Merck UAT testing platforms such as MS AppCenter.

Management of Digital Marketing Services’ Apple and Google Play Store accounts, including developer accounts. Including, but not limited to: creating/managing app ids, entitlements, provisioning profiles, signing certificates and keystores; creating store listings; submitting builds for review by Apple/Google; managing TestFlight/Google Play Test channels; and functioning as the liaison between our company and Apple/Google to resolve issues.

Liaison with other teams for release and management of internal applications to the Apps store, including change management administration.

Ensuring apps meet compliance, branding, and security reviews prior to release, including providing suitability advice on future application plans.

Updating the in-house asset management system (WebUniverse) with mobile application details.

Responsible for managing the app analytics and reporting. This includes:

Setting up application projects and providing Firebase configuration files to dev teams.

Setting up Google Firebase analytics reporting for app owners.

Run customized reports as/when requested for certain time periods.

Providing reports from App Store and Google Play Store statistics.

Technical Consultant to App Developers

Supporting agencies and troubleshooting with development issues that may occur, including providing advice based on source code reviews, black box, grey box, or white box testing.

Providing advice/recommending solutions for issues that may be reported during the vulnerability scanning process.

Providing input to agency partners on the implementation of development best practices during the mobile app development lifecycle

Providing advice on types of technologies accepted, and consulting with agencies on development capabilities. This includes working directly with an agency’s app developers to ensure suitability and quality.

Providing cross-platform support and creating builds from multiple different technologies.

Providing implementation advice to agencies and others on consuming remote APIs and web services. A familiarity with the processes involved in back-end server development, including suitable technologies and methodologies is required.

Team collaborator for process improvements

Providing an assessment of our current mobile app governance model to identify possible enhancements and implementation advice.

Contributing to an overall strategy for management of our mobile portfolio.

Assist in implementing maintenance program for all in-scope mobile apps, including on-going support.

Managing the mobile app certification program for agencies, including technical triage and feedback, performance scoring and overall evaluation. This will require a knowledge of software development best practices, as well as mobile app development best practices, as well as experience with meeting current Apple and Google publication requirements.


Bachelor’s Degree

At least 2 years’ professional experience is required developing or QA of applications with: Swift, Java, Kotlin,

Up to 2 years or greater of professional experience developing or QA of applications with Xamarin (.Net) and React-Native.

Unity

Our Animal Health Division is a trusted global leader in veterinary medicine, dedicated to preserving and improving health, well-being, and performance of animals and the people who care for them. We are a global team of professionals working together to make a positive difference in animal care and the world’s food supply and have a deep sense of responsibility towards our customers, consumers, animals, society, and our planet.

Through our commitment to The Science of Healthier Animals®, we offer veterinarians, farmers, pet owners and governments one of the widest ranges of veterinary pharmaceuticals, vaccines and health management solutions and services as well as an extensive suite of digitally connected identification, traceability and monitoring products. We invest in dynamic and comprehensive R&D resources and a modern, global supply chain. We are present in more than 50 countries, while our products are available in some 150 markets.

Who we are …

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our company is on a quest for cures and is committed to being the world’s premier, most research-intensive biopharmaceutical company. Today, we’re doubling down on this goal. Our company's Research Laboratories is a true scientific research facility of tomorrow and will take our company's leading discovery capabilities and world-class small molecule and biologics R&D expertise to create breakthrough science that radically changes the way we approach serious diseases.
The Data & Genome Sciences department is looking for a passionate and talented computational biologist with expertise in image analysis, to join our Translational Genome Analytics research team based in Cambridge, CA. In this role, you will apply image-based, AI/ML-based analytics to analyze large multi-scale and multi-omics datasets in collaboration with cross-functional teams of computational biologists, data scientists and colleagues in Discovery Research to drive target discovery and drug development efforts. Oncology research at our company is driven by a deep interest in the biology of tumor and its microenvironment, and how diverse points of intervention can be combined to achieve ever higher rates of durable response and patient overall survival.

In this role, you will use your experience in working on the latest big data, cloud technologies, and development methodologies involving cloud computing, NoSQL databases, security, encryption, data movement in order to help us leverage data and IoT events to deliver critical capabilities. You will lead a team of developers responsible for building new and support existing scalable cloud native web/webservices applications.
You should have the ability to prioritize well, communicate clearly, have a consistent track record of delivery and excellent software engineering skills. Creative engineering balanced with high quality and a customer focus. Must be able to work across multiple facets of the project and juggle multiple responsibilities at the same time. Strong analytic capability and the ability to create innovative solutions. We are looking for a highly motivated individual who is looking to grow their career in a fast-paced environment.
You will work on cutting-edge applications and products. Brainstorming with architects, product managers, data scientists and fellow engineers to build data products used improve the health outcomes of millions of people.

Title: Principal Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
McKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by the CDC, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.

As a McKesson Machine Learning Engineer (MLE), you'll be part of a lean software team dedicated to productionizing machine learning applications and systems at scale. You’ll participate in the detailed technical design, development, and implementation of machine learning applications using existing and emerging technology platforms. You’ll focus on machine learning architectural design, develop and review model and application code, and ensure high availability and performance of our machine learning applications. You'll have the opportunity to continuously learn and apply the latest innovations and best practices in machine learning engineering.

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will be joining a team of experienced Machine Learning Engineers that support, build, and enable Machine Learning capabilities across the organization. You will work closely with internal customers and infrastructure teams to build our next generation data science workbench and ML platform and products. You will be able to further expand your knowledge and develop your expertise in modern Machine Learning frameworks, libraries and technologies while working closely with internal stakeholders to understand the evolving business needs. If you have a penchant for creative solutions and enjoy working in a hands-on, collaborative environment, then this role is for you.







This is a full-time, salaried position with a salary range of $143,300 to $238,900 with benefits. McKesson offers Medical, Dental, Vision, Holidays and PTO.



McKesson believes superior performance – individual and team – that helps us drive innovations and solutions to promote better health should be recognized and rewarded. We provide a competitive compensation and benefits programs to attract, retain and motivate a high-performance workforce, and it’s flexible enough to meet the different needs of our diverse employee population. Title: Principal Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
ResMed has always applied the best of technology to improve people's lives. Now our SaaS technology is fueling a new era in the healthcare industry, with dynamic systems that change the way people receive care in settings outside of the hospital–and tools that work every day to help people stay well, longer. We have one of the largest actionable datasets in the industry, creating a complete view of people as they move between care settings. This is how we empower providers–with vital insight to deliver the care people need, right when they need it.
We're also ensuring that our health solutions connect to other companies' networks. Because when objectives align, everyone wins. And as we work today to drive better care and lower costs, we're developing more personalized solutions for tomorrow, utilizing machine learning, intelligent care paths, and predictive protocols. If you are an innovator who wants to make an impact we want to talk to you! We have exciting opportunities supporting Brightree by ResMed and MatrixCare by ResMed!
Let’s talk about the team
The primary role of Engineering function within Product Development team is to create specifications and designs for new products or improvements and enhancements to existing products. Works closely with customers, developers and other stakeholders to understand and define customer needs in these designs. Features are aligned to a timetable and areas of responsibility. Developers may solicit customers for feedback regarding product usability and desired future enhancements. Software Engineers who design, write and test code for the product should be matched in the either Software Engineering Applications or Systems. Product developers who specialize in hardware systems should be matched to Hardware Engineering.

Title: Principal Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
Change Healthcare is a leading healthcare technology company with a mission to inspire a better healthcare system. We deliver innovative solutions to patients, hospitals, and insurance companies to improve clinical decision making, simplify financial processes, and enable better patient experiences to improve lives and support healthier communities.
Senior Software Engineer (.NET/Cloud)
Change Healthcare is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to work on the Assurance Reimbursement Platform. This role will be responsible for design, development, test, and deployment of distributed software systems and Infrastructure as Code solutions in the AWS cloud. A successful candidate will have an established background in developing cloud applications, strong technical ability, and motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment. You will be working in a team providing technical leadership in lean/agile and DevOps practices, including test driven development, continuous integration and delivery, and engineering best practices. This role will author and review system designs, provide implementation plans, and implement the solution. The role will work with architects, other engineers, and product and program managers in an Agile/SCRUM environment to deliver the requested features and improvements to the software. This role will help with future hiring and provide technical leadership to the team.

This position requires a good understanding of AWS cloud native technologies like ECS, Lambda, Fargate, S3, Kinesis, Message Queues, and RDS. The ability to work in an existing large Dot Net based monolith application and systematically move it to the cloud native microservices based architecture without disrupting the end user experience is a key component of this position.

You will be working on Change Healthcare’s Assurance Reimbursement Platform, one of the most widely used integrated claims and remittance management solutions for healthcare providers. Our platform helps prevent Healthcare claim denials, facilitates fast bill reimbursement, and improves the efficiency of the revenue cycle workflow. We are modernizing the Assurance platform as well as building new features/services using cloud-native technologies, modern UI frameworks, and DevOps best practices.


Engage in building new features and services for the Assurance Reimbursement Platform leveraging an evolving set of languages and technologies including C#, Go, Python, TypeScript/Javascript, and AWS services such as ECS, Lambda, Fargate, S3, and Kinesis.

This is an Individual contributor role, which requires strong hands-on expertise in building modern apps based on different tech stack Java, NodeJS, JavaScript, React and/or Angular development experience to help build our next-generation platform to ensure the delivery of use cases into products focused on helping people live healthier lives.

In this role, you will elevate the landscape of digital applications by bringing in new ideas, designs, technologies and exemplary code to contribute to a variety of strategic customer experience improvements. You’ll be evangelizing the future vision of digital engineering by brainstorming with architects, product managers, data scientists and fellow engineers to build data products used to improve the health outcomes of millions of people. The ideal candidate will be a strong analytical and critical thinker, and be able to simplify complex problems, processes or projects into component parts explore and evaluate them systematically. You will be developing cutting edge and highly complex applications.

Title: Data Scientist - December 2022 and May 2023 Graduates
Job_Description:
Do you want to use your analytical abilities to make an impact on the healthcare of others? Join CVS Health as a Care Management Analytics Data Scientist, where you will implement analytic reporting & technology as it relates to contractual analytic reporting needs, program value evaluation, issue resolution, capabilities and stabilization. Here, you will be a part of a growing, high impact team that support various care management analytic activities as an individual contributor.
Additionally, you will:
Run reconciliation report and build stories for outcomes and delivery team. Develop outcome reporting, analytics and interactive Tableau dashboards. Evaluate program performance, identify opportunities, and uncover areas for program improvement. Use the information learned to provide recommendations and solutions to business partners.
Perform analyses of structured and unstructured data to inform advanced statistical and mathematical analyses
To be successful in this role you will bring with you a demonstrated history of success utilizing oral and verbal communication skills to present information and build partnerships. You should also have a high level of attention to detail. Your problem-solving skills will be tested as you further your understanding of data reconciliation, reporting, and analysis.
Must be able to travel up to 10%. Travel may require but is not limited to flights, overnight stays, local travel, travel on short notice and other travel deemed necessary by the Company.

Title: Data Scientist - December 2022 and May 2023 Graduates
Job_Description:
It’s a new day in health care!

Combining CVS Health and Aetna was a ground-breaking moment for our company and our industry, establishing CVS Health as the nation’s premier health innovation company. Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, we’re pioneering a bold new approach to total health.

As a CVS Health colleague, you’ll be at the center of it all. We offer a diverse work experience that empowers colleagues for career success. In addition to skill and experience, we also seek to attract and retain colleagues whose beliefs and behaviors are in alignment with our core values of collaboration, innovation, caring, integrity and accountability.

In any given day, you will:

The Analytics & Behavior Change team sits at the intersection of CVS and Aetna. We are an elite, rapidly growing community of nearly 1,000 MDs, PhDs, MBAs, and MScs from top-tier universities and industries who bring their clinical, technical, and economic experience to bear in tackling some of today’s most critical healthcare questions.

Get in at the ground floor of our digital transformation. The combined data assets of CVS and Aetna are massive and largely untapped. Help us revolutionize healthcare by innovating solutions to high-visibility challenges with unparalleled access to unique datasets.


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 75,000
Maximum: 167,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


3+ years of hands-on experience with SQL, Python, R, Tableau and/or other data, statistical analytics tools and techniques


Demonstrates proficiency in most areas of mathematical analysis methods, machine learning, statistical analyses, and predictive modeling and in-depth specialization in some areas.

Strong knowledge of advanced analytics tools and languages to analyze large data sets from multiple data sources


Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Economics, Physics, Engineering, or related discipline.

Master’s degree or PhD preferred

As a member of the Analytics & Behavior Change Merchandising Analytics team, you will be at the forefront of delivering high visibility analytic projects for key CVS Retail strategic priorities. Specifically, you will have the opportunity to drive revenue and customer satisfaction in CVS Health’s Front Store business using advanced analytic solutions to optimizing assortment, promotion and pricing decisions.

You will be called on to work cross functionally with a range of technical and non-technical partners, building partnerships with multiple stakeholders and translating their business needs into problems which can be solved using analytics, statistics, and machine learning. We are a fast-paced team focused on building innovative analytic solutions using AI/ML and cloud capabilities. Within our team, we believe a cutting-edge AI products and analytics can only be delivered if every aspect of the solution from data to model to front end UI is fully designed and developed by the team. As a Lead Data Scientist, you will be expected to partner with technical and business stakeholders to deliver business insights with advanced analytics, models and intuitive front end user interfaces using best in class cloud and AI platforms. We are looking for talented individuals who have a strong sense of ownership, accountability and a desire to deliver high quality end to end intuitive and impactful analytic products using advanced data driven approaches.

Title: AVP, Machine Learning Platforms
Job_Description:
As the AVP of Machine Learning Platforms you will be responsible for building and executing the data and technology strategy for CVS Health’s Analytics & Behavior Change organization. You will communicate the strategy to a diverse group of business stakeholders, analytics partners, and end users across CVS Health. You will mentor and inspire other managers and engineers, participate in defining our engineering culture, and help to grow and nurture a highly self-motivated team.
As a senior engineering leader, you will be driving engineering build of CVS next generation machine learning platform on GCP. This ML platform is to coordinate and automate CVS enterprise machine learning practices, from data, model training, model inference, to integration of ML assets into business operations for value realization. This platform is the core engineering component for CVS ‘AI First’ enterprise technology strategy.

Pay Range
The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 189,400
Maximum: 416,700

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


The ideal candidate will have many of the following qualifications 10+ years of overall experience with but not limited to the following

Title: AVP, Machine Learning Platforms
Job_Description:
This position lies within the Data Science Optimization team. The DSO team focuses on ML platform design and product development aimed at improving the productivity and efficacy of hundreds of fellow data scientists and engineers throughout the organization. Every project is far reaching and ambitious with the potential to become a new internal standard, an OSS project, or differentiating intellectual property. This position will:
Provide strategic leadership by identifying opportunities related to the data science lifecycle and developing solutions.
Help inform the design of and roadmap for our enterprise ML platform and cloud infrastructure.
Lead development of domain specific analytics frameworks and data science packages.
Use statistics and machine learning to analyze petabytes of health care data.
Embrace a product and systems mindset when developing solutions at scale.


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 120,000
Maximum: 265,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.






Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Physics, Engineering, or related discipline. Masters degree or PhD preferred.

Title: Data Engineer - December 2022 and May 2023 Graduates
Job_Description:
CVS Health has a rich set of healthcare data for more than 150 million individuals and provides the best foundation for any ambitious data engineer to:
Solve the complex business problems using all the modern tools and technologies
Securely store, process, transform and enrich terabyte to petabyte scale of highly confidential healthcare data that helps in taking data driven business decisions
Provide best-in-class environment where everyone brings their heart to work to build technical solutions to support customers.

As a Data Engineer you will:
Develop scalable and reliable cloud-native solutions by following the architecture and dev ops best practices to support reusable, extensible, configurable components to deploy data products for business and analytics use cases for real-time and batch use cases.


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 60,000
Maximum: 128,700

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


1+ years of progressively complex related experience



Cloud certifications (Data engineering/Solution Architecture). GCP/Azure preferred


Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Sciences, Data Analytics, or related quantitative field

Title: Data Engineer - December 2022 and May 2023 Graduates
Job_Description:
CVS Health has a rich set of healthcare data of more than 150 million individuals and provides the best foundation for any ambitious data engineer to work on billions of records of healthcare data. The Data Engineering Advisor will lead the design of highly scalable and extensible data platforms including but not limited to RDBMS / Big Data / Cloud, which enables industrializing collection, storage, modeling, and analysis of massive data sets from heterogeneous channels.

Responsibilities:
Collect, analyze, and synthesize complex information from disparate sources into a single reporting view/data layer using SQL or similar tools. Summarize results and present findings to our non-analytic audiences
Conduct analyses of data, ranging from descriptive ad-hoc analyses to in-depth investigations of healthcare utilization trends/outcomes and prepare data summarization presentation for review by leadership team and key stakeholders


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 60,000
Maximum: 128,700

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.

Title: Data Engineer - December 2022 and May 2023 Graduates
Job_Description:
"Aetna Resources LLC, a CVS Health company, is hiring for the following role in New York, NY: Sr. Data Engineer to Design and develop complex and largescale data structures and pipelines to organize, collect, and standardize data to generate meaningful insights and address reporting needs. Duties include: build data products involving real time and ingestion frameworks, data pipelines to process large volumes of structured and unstructured data, and model deployment; prepare and execute on strategic data roadmap; build and integrate data platforms and supporting products to drive engagements and revolutionize health and wellness; write complex
Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) processes, design database systems, and develop tools for real-time and offline analytic processing; design data models to support Data Science and other internal customers; and collaborate with Data Science team to transform data and integrate algorithms and models into highly available production
systems."


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 160813
Maximum: 160813

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


Master’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Analytics, Data Science, or a related field and completion of a university-level course, research project, internship, thesis, or 6 months of experience in each of the following: CI/CD, Jenkins, GIT, or DevOps; Java, R, and Python; SQL or SAS; Hadoop or HDFS commands; Visualization tools, including PowerBI or Tableau; Spark or PySpark; and Software development lifecycle.

Title: Data Engineer - December 2022 and May 2023 Graduates
Job_Description:
Assists in the development of large-scale data structures and pipelines to organize, collect and standardize data that helps generate insights and addresses reporting needs

Applies understanding of key business drivers to accomplish own work

Uses expertise, judgment and precedents to contribute to the resolution of moderately complex problems

Leads portions of initiatives of limited scope, with guidance and direction

Writes ETL (Extract / Transform / Load) processes, designs database systems and develops tools for real-time and offline analytic processing

Collaborates with client team to transform data and integrate algorithms and models into automated processes

Uses knowledge in Hadoop architecture, HDFS commands and experience designing & optimizing queries to build data pipelines

Uses programming skills in Python, Java or any of the major languages to build robust data pipelines and dynamic systems

Builds data marts and data models to support clients and other internal customers

Integrates data from a variety of sources, assuring that they adhere to data quality and accessibility standards


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 60,000
Maximum: 128,700

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


1+ years of progressively complex related experience

Experience with bash shell scripts, UNIX utilities & UNIX Commands


Ability to leverage multiple tools and programming languages to analyze and manipulate data sets from disparate data sources

Ability to understand complex systems and solve challenging analytical problems

Strong problem-solving skills and critical thinking ability

Strong collaboration and communication skills within and across teams

Knowledge in Java, Python, Hive, Cassandra, Pig, MySQL or NoSQL or similar

Knowledge in Hadoop architecture, HDFS commands and experience designing & optimizing queries against data in the HDFS environment

Experience building data transformation and processing solutions

Has strong knowledge of large-scale search applications and building high volume data pipelines


Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in Computer Science, Engineering, Machine Learning, or related discipline

Master’s degree or PhD preferred

Fortune 5 CVS Health has a dynamic opportunity for a Senior Data Engineer to join our dedicated Pharmacy Services Finance team.

You will be responsible for understanding, preparing, processing, and analyzing data. You will be tasked with making the data valuable and useful for operational and/or decision-making purposes.

You may need to team with either Business Intelligence, Data Governance, and data engineers to automate metrics and to create highly useful information. This position requires collaboration skills as it is necessary to work cross functionally and influence a wide range of Pharmacy Services finance departments. Ideal candidate will have good analytical and communication skills. In addition, the individual must be able to independently interact with and influence senior partners and demonstrate a proven track record of delivering results.
In this role you will design, model, document, and guide the logical and conceptual relationship of data for metrics and analytics. Analyze customer needs and investigate data available for analysis.

Position can sit in Cumberland-RI, Hartford-CT preferred. But, also open to Work from Home-Flexible.

Title: Data Engineer - December 2022 and May 2023 Graduates
Job_Description:
It's a new day!

Combining CVS Health and Aetna was a ground-breaking moment for our company and our industry, establishing CVS Health as the nation’s premier health innovation company. Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, we’re pioneering a bold new approach to total health.

Want to help drive the next level of growth at a leading national B2C healthcare brand, touching millions of prospects and members? We’re looking for go-to-market leaders to drive innovation and growth in Aetna’s Medicare Business, using consumer marketing, sales, and product design that leverages data science and consulting skills to help Aetna acquire new members.

Our Medicare Analytics team is integrated into all of Aetna’s go-to-market activities, including overall growth strategies, business case development, customer segmentation, product design, media mix planning, attribution modeling, and member retention. We infuse data science into all growth analytics, powered by petabytes of data, and the latest machine learning techniques.

In the past 4 years our membership has doubled, and our market share has grown 50%; you will help us take this to the next level, using your passion for problem solving, quantitative analysis, and analytic storytelling to identify, incubate, and deploy the next set of innovations to power the growth of tomorrow’s business.

Overview:


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 60,000
Maximum: 128,700

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.






Bachelor’s degree in quantitative field, or an equivalent combination of formal education and experience.

Master's degree in quantitative field or MBA strongly preferred
