Title: Data Engineer - December 2022 and May 2023 Graduates
Job_Description:
CVS Health has a rich set of healthcare data of more than 150 million individuals and provides the best foundation for any ambitious data engineer to work on billions of records of healthcare data. The Data Engineering Advisor will lead the design of highly scalable and extensible data platforms including but not limited to RDBMS / Big Data / Cloud, which enables industrializing collection, storage, modeling, and analysis of massive data sets from heterogeneous channels.

Responsibilities:

1. Collect, analyze, and synthesize complex information from disparate sources into a single reporting view/data layer using SQL or similar tools. Summarize results and present findings to our non-analytic audiences
2. Conduct analyses of data, ranging from descriptive ad-hoc analyses to in-depth investigations of healthcare utilization trends/outcomes and prepare data summarization presentation for review by leadership team and key stakeholders
3. Apply problem-solving and analytical skills to conduct quality assurance testing on data from initial delivery to final merged product to ensure results are accurate and aligned with documented requirements
4. Support skill development of team by sharing knowledge, developing, and sharing new technical skills, and providing guidance and mentorship to other team members.
5. Ensure proper maintenance and centralized storage of key project documentation including business requirements, technical specifications, design documents, test plans, etc.
6. Construct and deliver written reports of analytic findings in a variety of formats (reports, PPT, including visualization of data and findings), formulate recommendations, and effectively present results to stakeholders
7. Lead discussions on data ingestion standardization, data conformance/quality and audit balance control
8. Build data semantic layer, test, validate and present to analytical and reporting team.
9. Design/develop data security model, views, tables for specific business use cases.
10. Build innovative, scalable, parameterized, efficient solutions around data


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 75,000
Maximum: 167,000

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


3 years of business experience leading analyses and initiatives with a track record of business impact or a master’s degree with 1-year of experience
3 years of experience programming using R, Hadoop, Python, SQL
3 years of experience in BI data visualization in Tableau




Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Physics, Math, or related field:
or Advanced Degree

Preferred: Master’s Degree with coursework focused on advanced algorithms, mathematics in computing, data structures, or related field

Title: Data Engineer - December 2022 and May 2023 Graduates
Job_Description:
Fortune 5 CVS Health has a dynamic opportunity for a Senior Analyst/Data Engineer to join our dedicated Pharmacy Services Finance team. You’ll join a team focused on building data pipelines to support new and existing products as well as optimizing existing processes and integrating new data sets. You will own the end-to-end delivery of highly scalable, high-performance data integration and transformation models. You will function as the solution architect for building the data pipelines to support the development/enablement of data democratization. You will collaborate with the BI team and stakeholders to decompose complex data/ETL problems into simple, straight-forward solutions.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
 Engage in requirements and solution concept development, requiring strong analytic and communication skills.
 Lead data curation efforts and ensure the quality and timeliness of datasets.
 Plan, document, develop, and QA data models, including but not limited to ETL technical specifications, design, code, test, implement, and support optimal data solutions.
 Write and modify complex SQL Queries to support new development or enhancements of existing data pipelines seamlessly.
 Monitor jobs and identifying bottlenecks in the data processing pipeline.
 Test and troubleshoot problems in workflow designs and processes to improve resolve issues relating to the storage, handling, and access of data.
 Create and maintain documentation for data mappings, data dictionaries, processes, and other solutions as per established standards for data governance.
 Assist project leaders in determining project timelines and objectives.
 Identify and promote opportunities for optimization and automation.


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 43,700
Maximum: 97,400

Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.


3 or more years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
3 or more years of experience performing data modeling, building data processes and ETL pipelines in a data mart or data warehouse environment.
3 or more years of experience processing and modeling large, complex data sets for Analytical use cases with Database technologies such as Alteryx Desktop, SAP HANA Studio, Teradata or equivalent.
3 or more years of experience creating SQL queries


 Demonstrated ability to complete multiple tasks under pressure with a high degree of flexibility.
 Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills with the ability to identify and influence others on the best solution.
 Ability to work well in a team environment and attitude to focus on team specific goals and objectives.
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills and a commitment to engage and collaborate with people across a variety of levels with diverse backgrounds.
 Familiarity with BI and Visualization platforms such as Tableau.
 Adapts and is willing to learn new tasks, methods, and systems.
 Strong individual team contributor and collaborator.
 Should be well versed with Agile delivery methodology.

 Working knowledge of data management systems, practices and standards.

Do you want to make a large impact in your next role? Join CVS Health, a Fortune 5 company as a Financial Analytics Senior Consultant of Client and Network Pricing Operations. This position is responsible for contributing to the effort of managing client guarantee performance, reviewing contract language and collaborating with multiple internal partners such as Underwriting, Networks, Sales/Account Management, Finance, Accounting, Audit and Legal.

The Pricing Operations Senior Analyst will review guarantee performance by client on a monthly basis, prepare financial performance reporting, provide reporting and information for audit requests, and partner with Underwriting, Networks, Sales/Account Management, Audit and Legal, to review contract terms and provide recommendations for pricing strategy.

Perform monthly data pulls for assigned guarantee clients. Review performance results, drug mix and utilization to identify opportunities to mitigate financial risk to the organization.

Title: Sr Data Analyst - Hybrid Position
Job_Description:
As a SR Analyst, you will have the opportunity to maintain strong relationships with our Employer Group Waiver Plan (EGWP) clients. Your role will be essential for ensuring that all eligible beneficiaries are successfully enrolled in their respective Medicare Part-D plans and perform in accordance with Center for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) guidelines. You will serve as the business expert for your clients in order to drive retention of the client base through successful results and supportive client consultation.

You will be responsible for owning and managing a book of business across multiple clients, resolving enrollment discrepancies, performing complex day-to-day enrollment tasks, understanding and applying Medicare Part D Guidelines, and managing small improvement projects. You will also have the opportunity to develop and maintain strong relationships with our clients and internal partners.

Title: Sr Data Analyst - Hybrid Position
Job_Description:
We are looking for a highly motivated candidate who can effectively and accurately review behavioral health claims, identify inaccuracies, perform root cause analysis, and provide input on potential solutions. The candidate will be required to process/reprocess claims or submit rework projects as needed. You will work closely with business partners providing review updates, root cause analysis summary, solutioning and detailed resolution of affected claims. The candidate is responsible for ensuring claim reviews stay on track and are resolved accurately by the specified due date.

The candidate will serve as the lead for various claim and benefit reviews such as compliance claim reviews, provider and member escalated complaints, network, and clinical requests for claim assistance.

Maintain a specialized knowledge of Behavioral Health claim processing and policy impacts.

Maximum: 97,400

The Business Analyst, will be the IT Government Services point of contact for Security & Compliance related monitoring, finding remediation, vulnerability remediation, status reporting, and project initiatives. This individual will work with the various application teams to answer questions, provide direction, and ensure that vulnerabilities assigned to each group are remediated in a timely fashion. The Analyst, Business Analysis, will also represent the IT Government Services team in the various Pharmacy Services Segment security and compliance meetings, coordinate project initiatives, maintain application inventories, and update/maintain various internal tracking tools. This individual will also be responsible for producing and presenting weekly status reports for the leadership teams. In addition, this individual will also be supporting various annual enrollment and welcome season activities including command & control support, readiness coordination, and performance testing tracking.

1. Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both spoken and written, with the ability to communicate effectively to all levels of management.

CVS Health has an exciting opportunity to join our PBM Finance Enablement group as a Sr. Reporting Analyst within our Data, Analytics, and Automation team. CVS Health strives to continuously innovate around how we report and analyze data, improve operational efficiency, and deliver outstanding customer service.

You will work with pharmacy and member specific claims data including, but not limited to, financial and operational information supporting state and federal compliance reporting. This position requires formulation, preparation, and communication of strategic IFP business requirements by providing data support and monitoring the organizations overall strategic direction. Title: Sr Data Analyst - Hybrid Position
Job_Description:
We are looking for a highly motivated candidate who can effectively and accurately review behavioral health claims, identify inaccuracies, perform root cause analysis, and provide input on potential solutions. The candidate will be required to process/reprocess claims or submit rework projects as needed. You will work closely with business partners providing review updates, root cause analysis summary, solutioning and detailed resolution of affected claims. The candidate is responsible for ensuring claim reviews stay on track and are resolved accurately by the specified due date.

The candidate will serve as the lead for various claim and benefit reviews such as compliance claim reviews, provider and member escalated complaints, network, and clinical requests for claim assistance.

Maintain a specialized knowledge of Behavioral Health claim processing and policy impacts.

Title: Sr Data Analyst - Hybrid Position
Job_Description:
Do you want to make a large impact in your next role? Join CVS Health, a Fortune 5 company as a Financial Analytics Senior Consultant of Client and Network Pricing Operations. This position is responsible for contributing to the effort of managing client guarantee performance, reviewing contract language and collaborating with multiple internal partners such as Underwriting, Networks, Sales/Account Management, Finance, Accounting, Audit and Legal.

The Pricing Operations Senior Analyst will review guarantee performance by client on a monthly basis, prepare financial performance reporting, provide reporting and information for audit requests, and partner with Underwriting, Networks, Sales/Account Management, Audit and Legal, to review contract terms and provide recommendations for pricing strategy.

Primary responsibilities include:
Perform monthly data pulls for assigned guarantee clients. Review performance results, drug mix and utilization to identify opportunities to mitigate financial risk to the organization.

The successful candidate will have analytical, programming, and interpersonal skills, be able to manage both long- and short- term projects and assignments effectively, and work collaboratively in inter-departmental settings to accomplish tasks and goals. You will have the opportunity to develop reporting packages and presentations to management, create best-practices, and draw conclusions from the information to provide input to critical business decisions. Key interactions are with Underwriting, Networks, Sales/Account Management, Finance, Accounting, Audit and Legal.


The typical pay range for this role is:
Minimum: 43,700
Maximum: 97,400
